title: Order of the Daleks
author: Mike Tucker
filename: 218 - Order of the Daleks - Mike Tucker_djvu.txt

elements.text: PART ONE
1: INT. MONASTERY CORRIDOR
MONASTIC CHANTING — WELL OFF (FROM CHAPEL).
Esta, bevay, oona, panitay, Esta, bevay, seela, noomala...
Page 2
YOUNG MEN CREEP SLOWLY FORWARDS, FOOTSTEPS ECHOING ON
GABBER IS CONFIDENT AND ASSERTIVE;
IS NERVOUS.
Come on, Rosco!
Stop bullying me, Gabber. I’m not a child.
No, but you are my younger brother.
Only by two minutes.
I’m still older!
Still — we shouldn’t be here, Gabber. We’1ll get caught!
Stop dawdling, then, and follow me!
A MAN APPROACHES FROM THE CORRIDOR BEHIND THEM.
Rosco? Gabber?
(STARTLED) Master Boswyck!
What are you doing in the East Range? You two should be
preparing for Vespers.
(STRUGGLING TO EXPLAIN) We were... uh...
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 3
(ASSURED) We were helping Allget the Unsteady with his chores.
(SUSPICIOUS) Really?
Yes, he needed help bringing in the planna weed and drilf beans for tonight’s supper.
How charitable of you. — Hurry and join the other novices, then. The candles in the chapel will not light themselves.
ROSCO and GABBER: Yes, Master Boswyck.
PATTER OF FOOTSTEPS AS THE BOYS HURRY AWAY.
Novices.
HE WALKS OFF. FADE.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 4
2: INT. ANOTHER MONASTERY CORRIDOR
FX: FADE UP. GABBER AND ROSCO HURRY TO HALT.
Right, here’s the door.
Are you mad? We can’t carry on now, Gabber — Master Boswyck saw us!
And he thinks that he saw us run off to the chapel, too. Don’t you see, Rosco? There’ll never be a better time to investigate the passage!
I still think Raspak’s going to miss that key...
Raspak will far too busy strutting about giving orders to notice. We’ll have it back on his belt before he even realises that it’s gone.
How do you even know it’s the right one?
CLATTERING INTO A LOCK; CREAK OF A DOOR OPENING.
Because it works...
A NOISE DRIFTS DOWN FROM INSIDE THE PASSAGEWAY.
‘HEARTBEAT’ RHYTHM AS THE DALEK CONTROL ROOM SOUND EFFECT — BUT AN ORGANIC VERSION.
I hear something. Down there.
It’s just echoes. — Now, are you coming or not?
I can’t...
Surely you want to know what all the secrecy’s about? What Raspak and the others are guarding so closely?
I’m too scared.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 5
You always were the timid one, little brother. — Stay here, then, and keep watch.
HE STARTS TO SCRAMBLE INTO THE PASSAGEWAY. WE STAY WITH ROSCO AS GABBER MAKES HIS WAY DOWN THE PASSAGEWAY.
(SOTTO) Can you see anything?
(HISSED FROM OFF — DOWN PASSAGEWAY) Give my eyes a chance to adjust, it’s dark in here — (BREAKS OFF) No, wait, I can see something...
(HISSED) See what?
NOISE FROM INSIDE PASSAGEWAY — A SCUFFLING AND A
HISS (WHICH WE LATER LEARN WAS A DALEK MUTANT).
(HISSED) What can you see? Gabber? (BEAT; LOUDER NOW) Gabber??
(SCREAMS FROM OFF) Aaaaaaaargh!
Gabber! Are you hurt? Gabber! Gabber?
RETURNING — RAGGED, FRIGHTENED BREATHING, CONTINUES THROUGH:
There you are, thank goodness. Come on, we need to get away from here. (BEAT) Gabber? What’s wrong? What happened down there? Gabber, why won’t you speak? Please, just say something! Gabber!!!
FADE.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 6
3: EXT. MOORLAND

TRUMPETING OF THE TARDIS INTERRUPTS THE SONG OF DISTANT ALIEN BIRDS AND THE MOOING AND SNUFFLING OF A HERD OF LARGE ALIEN BEASTS. A ‘THUMP’ AS IT FULLY MATERIALISES, THEN RATTLE OF DOOR AS THE DOCTOR AND CONSTANCE STEP OUT.
Here we are, Mrs Clarke — the planet Strellin.
It’s very rural.
No technology to speak of, no terra-forming geo-machines. A veritable Shangri-La. (BREATHES IN DRAMATICALLY) Just take a lungful of that air!
(BREATHS IN — THEN COUGHS AND SPLUTTERS AS SHE CATCHES A WHIFF OF MANURE) Ugh. Country air, certainly.
I admit, it’s not as fragrant as one might have hoped. But a natural odour, nonetheless. Those are the culprits, I suspect.
LOWING AND RUSTLING AS THE HERD OF ANIMALS GETS CLOSER.
A herd of Brandelak. Grazing herbivores. Making their way to the southern plains for the winter, no doubt.
Space buffalo. They’re really rather magnificent.
Indeed they are. “Until one has loved an animal a part of one’s soul remains unawakened.” Anatole France.
Well, I hope they’re safe from big game hunters.
Don’t you worry, Mrs Clarke. The only humans in this region of Strellin, so far as I’m aware, are the members of the Brotherhood of the Black Petal.
They sound rather menacing.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 7
Oh, far from it. They’re an ancient order of monks, noted for their exquisite works in stained glass.
(SIGHS) I wish I had a camera.
Yes, the panorama is rather pleasing. (THOUGHTFULLY) I do believe I’ve got a Box Brownie tucked away in one of the TARDIS cupboards. Won’t be a jiffy...
CLATTER OF DOOR AS THE DOCTOR VANISHES INSIDE THE TARDIS,
CONSTANCE LISTENING TO THE MOOING BRANDELAK.
(TO HERSELF) Savour every last moment, my girl. Every... last... moment.
SUDDENLY A VOICE CALLS OUT FROM THE DISTANCE.
(DISTANT) I say, you there!
(STARTLED) Who’s that?
(APPROACHING, CALLING OUT) Yes, you, girl! Wait there!
(CALLING BACK INTO TARDIS) Doctor... we appear to have company. A man and a woman!
(ARRIVES, PUFFING AND PANTING) What are you doing here, with such an incongruous box?
Me? Just, er, taking in the air. Hello.
(CHEERILY) Hello.
Don’t engage with her, Asta!
Sorry, Assessor Pendle.
I only said hello...
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 8
(INDIGNANT) Yes, if nothing in the world were wrong!
Is there a problem? Am I trespassing?
As if you don’t know. Standing there in synthetic clothes for all the world to see. And as for this eyesore of a box...! (TUTTING) Well, I’m afraid that it is going to incur a hefty fine...
DOOR CLATTERS OPEN AS THE DOCTOR EMERGES.
This ‘eyesore’, as you call it, is mine. I am the Doctor, and this is Mrs Constance Clarke. Now what’s all this about a fine?
Two of you, by Jiminy. Well, sir, you have both just found yourselves in a great deal of trouble. A great deal of trouble indeed...
Is that so? May I ask who you are, ‘sir’, and what exactly it is we’re supposed to have done?
Are you aware of the name of this planet, sir?

(STARTING TO BRISTLE NOW) Yes, ‘sir’, I am very well aware of its name. The planet Strellin is renowned throughout the galaxy for its peaceful tranquillity, and if it is to retain that noble reputation will you please stop prevaricating and tell us who you are!
(ALSO BRISTLING) Prevaricating? Prevaricating?! I’ve never been [ So... ]
(INTERRUPTING TO KEEP THE PEACE) Doctor, this is planetary assessor Malcolm Pendle, of the Central Galactic Census Bureau. I’m junior assessor Jane Asta.
Probationary assessor. Let’s not get ahead of ourselves, shall we, Ms Asta?
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 9
No, Assessor. (CONFIDENTIALLY) It’s my first time out in the field.
Well it’s always good to get your hands dirty. (BEAT) Galactic Census, eh?
(PROUDLY) Indeed. You and your associate have just made planetfall on a grade three world without taking the proper precautions. Your appearance could do untold harm to the inhabitants.
But we’ve not seen any inhabitants. We’re in the middle of nowhere!
Allow me to reassure you. I am something of an expert when it comes to visiting pre-space age civilisations. (PROUDLY) I ama Time Lord.
A Time Lord, hm?
Indeed.
Then you should know better! Swanning around space and time as if you own it all. The arrogance of you people amazes me.
Arrogant? Me?
You won’t get away with this, you know. (PATTING SATCHEL) Now — where are my penalty fine notifications?
What are you going to do? Stick a ticket on my TARDIS? Well, let me tell you—
(INTERRUPTING) Stop it, both of you!
AN ABRUPT SILENCE.
That’s better. Will someone please tell me what a ‘grade three planet’ is, and why it is such a problem that we’re on one?
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 10
You pretend not to know...?
A grade three planet is one that has no significant technology, no knowledge of other worlds, and as such, has a protected status.
A mediaeval society, you’re saying.
Er, yes. Landings by offworlders are strictly prohibited.
Which rather brings us to the question of what you two are doing here, hmm?
We're, well —
(INTERRUPTING) We are here on a mission of an extremely sensitive nature.
Why? What have you found?
MERELY ‘HARRUMPHS’
Come on man, I might be able to help!
We've picked up a signal, you see —
(WARNING) Asta...
But surely they could be of assistance, Assessor...
(INTRIGUED NOW) A signal? From here?
What kind of a signal? A distress call of some kind?
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 11
The type of signal is academic! It’s the fact that it originates here at all!
It was definitely artificially generated? Not a natural occurrence?
We’d hardly be wasting our time here if that were remotely possible.
Why didn’t we pick up this signal in the TARDIS?
(THOUGHTFULLY) I’m not sure..
(DISMISSIVELY) Well, your equipment hardly looks state of the art...
Appearances can be deceptive. Still, it’s worth checking. Hold this Box Brownie for me, would you?
THE DOCTOR DUMPS THE CAMERA INTO HIS HANDS.
But — this is a camera! I shall have to confiscate this!
(RUMMAGING THROUGH POCKETS) Now somewhere in this pocket I should have... A-ha! (HE PULLS OUT A SCANNER)
A portable scanner?! — This irresponsible brandishing of anachronistic technology must stop!
Just be quiet for a moment, there’s a good chap. Now then...
HE TUNES THE CONTROLS. DISCORDANT WHISTLING CONTINUES AS WE
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 12
4: EXT. MOORLAND — A LITTLE WAY OFF [CONTINUOUS]
RUSTLING IN LONG GRASSES.
(HISSED) Stay down, Gabber! Don’t be alarmed. We mustn’t let them see us. — If you hadn’t heard the noise that blue box of
theirs made... (A BEAT — AS HE ‘HEARS’ GABBER’S UNSPOKEN QUESTION) No, I’ve never seen anything like it before, either.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 13
5: EXT. MOORLAND [CONTINUOUS]
A REGULAR, RHYTHMIC BEEPING ISSUES FROM THE SPEAKER.
That’s the signal!
Yes.. Well, there’s nothing natural about that. A subspace Signal, operating on a very narrow bandwidth.
Listen. It’s a repeating cycle. Like an SOS?
Any possibility that the inhabitants might have finally achieved grade two status has to be investigated.
I find it highly unlikely that this is something generated by the locals.
I agree. And if it’s not come from them, then...
(INTERRUPTING) Yes, well, that is why we are here. To investigate, not speculate. So if you will kindly unburden me of this ‘Box Brownie’
HE DUMPS IT BACK INTO THE DOCTOR’S HANDS.
. There. Come along, Asta, we’ve wasted quite enough time here.
So you know where the signal is coming from?
Yes, from the monastery in the valley.
Excellent! That’s where we were heading, anyway. We’1ll come with you.
Out of the question! Contact with such a reclusive order is a delicate matter, requiring years of training.
(FAWNING) Then we’ll be able to watch a master of the technique at work.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 14
Well, I suppose if you stay out of the way...
But of course. You’1ll barely notice us.
Very well. But your... associate should cover herself up. The monks are very impressionable. Not sure how they’d react to an overt display of femininity.
I hardly think my outfit’s likely to start a riot!
No, but Mr Pendle may have a point. I daresay the monks are rather naive. There’s a cloak in the TARDIS — perhaps you could...?
A cloak? — Oh, alright, then. But only because the breeze is a shade autumnal.
EXITS INTO TARDIS. CROSS TO:
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 15
6: EXT. MOORLAND — A LITTLE WAY OFF [CONTINUOUS]
THE GROUP AROUND THE TARDIS, HEARD FROM A DISTANCE.
(OFF) Thank you, Doctor. So many regulations have been broken already.
(OFF) Not at all.
(OFF) How long’s she going to be? I don’t think we should wait.
(SOTTO; TO GABBER) Demons? You really think...? The one in the colours looks very strange, you’re right.
— TARDIS DOOR OPENS AGAIN.
(OFF) Better?
(OFF) Splendid. — I trust that hood covers Mrs Clarke’s lovely features sufficiently, Pendle?
(OFF) Yes, yes, yes. Now, come along. I’ve no intention of being out on this moor after dark.
(OFF) Then please, lay on!
THEY SET OFF ACROSS THE MOORLAND, FOOSTEPS FADING. A RUSTLE AS
GETS TO HIS FEET.
All right, Gabber. They’ve gone now.
AS GABBER RISES FROM GRASSES.
We must warn Master Boswyck about these demons. And if we take
the old Brandelak trail.. we can beat them to the monastery.
THE TWO BOYS HURRY AWAY.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 16
7: EXT. MOORLAND. EVENING
FADE UP. DOCTOR AND CONSTANCE WALKING BRISKLY BEHIND PENDLE AND ASTA.
So what do you think’s going on here, Doctor? Do you suppose that signal came from someone else who’s landed on this planet?

Possibly. I only hope your ‘big game’ theory turns out to be incorrect. (MUSING) That said.. there was something oddly familiar about the pattern of that signal, if I could only put my finger on it...
(CALLING BACK FROM A LITTLE WAY AHEAD) Come along, you two. Don’t dawdle. Our destination is in sight!
The monastery?
Just over this rise, I suspect.. Ah, and there it is!
Goodness. It’s more like a palace!
That’s why I was so keen to see it. A wonder of timber, masonry and stained glass, crafted by— (BREAKS OFF SUDDENLY; A GASP OF
AS SOMETHING PIERCES HIS MIND) Ah!
Doctor? Are you all right?
(COMING OVER) Are you in pain, man?
(RECOVERING) No, no, I’m fine. Just a mental twinge, that’s all.
A mental twinge?
A momentary telepathic contact, perhaps...?
Telepathy? With someone here?
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 17
Well, I’m only speculating.
What rubbish. Come along, Asta. We’re nearly at the gates.
HE STRIDES OFF, FOLLOWED BY THE OTHERS.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 18
8: INT. BOSWYCK’S APOTHECARY
CLANGING OF BELL — CONTINUES. ROSCO AND GABBER’S FOOTSTEPS ON FLAGSTONES OF CORRIDOR OUTSIDE, THEN A FRANTIC KNOCKING ON THE OUTSIDE OF THE WOODEN DOOR.
(OUTSIDE; BREATHLESS) Master Boswyck! Master Boswyck!
Come.
CLATTERS OPEN.
(BREATHLESS) Master Boswyck, [I-—]
Rosco and Gabber. Why is it that whenever there is noise and commotion, you two are always the source of it?
Master Boswyck — we are beset by demons!
(SCEPTICAL) Demons, Rosco?
My brother and I were on the moor. There was a terrible noise, then we saw a box had apparated there, bringing two oddly- dressed demons to our lands!
Two, you say? A veritable horde.
They were then joined by two more.
Also demons?
No, they were in plain robes. Their acolytes, perhaps! The box in which they arrived still stands on the moor. We must tell the Abbot. The demons must be banished before they destroy us all!
Let’s not get over-excited, shall we, Rosco? [I accept that you
may have seen something unusual...]
MEANWHILE, RASPAK HAS BEEN HURRYING ALONG CORRIDOR OUTSIDE.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 19
(ARRIVING) Master Boswyck, have you seen — (SEES ROSCO AND GABBER) Rosco and Gabber. There you are. Why did you ignore the alarum?
A-alarum, sir?
The bell, idiot boy!
Raspak — the bell always sounds this time of an evening.
This isn’t a call to drill, Boswyck. Four strangers approach the gates. I need all the novices to ready arms.
(WHISPERING) The demons!
What was that, boy?
Oh, pay him no heed. The boy has been suffering from troubled sleep. I was merely preparing a herbal remedy for him.
Well, make it quick — the strangers will be here any moment, and I need these two outside.
HE LEAVES, SLAMMING THE DOOR BEHIND HIM.
We must warn them, Master Boswyck. The demons...
Strangers, Rosco, strangers. Let’s find out a little bit more about them before we label them denizens of hell and condemn them to the flames, hm?
But...
(STERNLY) I’ve spared you Raspak’s wrath. Now we’ll have no more talk of apparating demons and acolytes — you understand?
Yes, Master Boswyck.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 20

Gabber, too. Not that you’1ll be telling anyone anything, I suppose, Since you adopted this ‘vow of silence’. But nonetheless...? (BEAT WHILE GABBER NODS) Good. Run along now and join the other novices. I shall take the information you have given me to the Abbot.
Yes, Master Boswyck.
THE TWO BOYS HURRY OUT.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 21
9: EXT. OUTSIDE MONASTERY GATES
BELL CONTINUES AS DOCTOR, CONSTANCE, PENDLE AND ASTA ARRIVE AT THE MONASTERY GATES.
Imposing gates, aren’t they?
A symphony in carved flowers. As I said, the Brotherhood are
master craftsmen.
Yes, but gates this size usually mean one thing:
They do?
“Keep out.”
So how do we get in — knock?
You will do no such thing. Asta — please relate the first principle of first contact?
“We must make our presence known in a non-aggressive way.”
Now, [watch as I attempt to do just that...]
CLATTER OF BOLTS BEING DRAWN...
I don’t think that will be necessary.
. AND THE GATES OF THE MONASTERY BEGIN TO OPEN.
The gates are opening!
Now then. Leave all the talking to me. These are simple people...
(OFF) There they are. Present arms!
(PRESENT ARMS WITH A NOISY HAKA-LIKE CRY) Ha!!!
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 22
Simple people with staffs and spears...
(STEPPING FORWARD) Greetings, gentle brothers, we are merchants...
(OFF) Seize them!
(CHARGE FORWARD, OVERWHELMING THE GROUP) Raaaaaaaaaaaaaa-!
CHARGE FORWARD. SCUFFLING.
(GRABBED) Now really, there is no need for this aggression!
(GRABBED) Ah!
(GRABBED) Do you mind!
Cease! (STEPPING FORWARD) Speak! — why have you come?
My c-colleague and I are humble merchants, nothing more.
Then why do the two in the cloaks hide their faces with hoods?
EY...
(LOWERING HOOD) As you see, we’ve nothing to hide.
GASP
(HASTILY) These two... er, boys, are our apprentices. I assure you, they’re quite harmless!
That’s for the Abbot to decide. (TO HIS MEN) You men: lock these... apprentice boys in one of the cells. —
ASTA AND CONSTANCE ARE BUNDLED AWAY.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 23
(AS SHE’S BUNDLED AWAY) You’ve seized us already, there’s no
need to drag us —
You others: these so-called ‘merchants’ are coming with me!
DOCTOR AND PENDLE ARE DRAGGED OFF IN ANOTHER DIRECTION.
(DRAGGED) Oh, mercy!
It is so enlightening watching a master of first contact at work.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 24
10: INT. ABBOT’S CHAMBER
FADE UP GENTLE TINKLING OF WINDCHIMES IN THE BACKGROUND.
CALM ATMOS. SCUFFLING FROM OFF AS 4 x NOVICES DRAG THE DOCTOR AND PENDLE IN.
(OFF) Oh, do be careful...
(OFF) There really is no need to manhandle us like this...
Halt!
STOP — SCUFFLING CEASES.
CURT — WE’LL LEARN THAT HE’S THE PUPPET OF THE BLACK DALEK
Raspak? What is this noise?
I apologise for disturbing the peace of your chamber, holy one, but these are the strangers.
Guards — release your grip.
DOCTOR AND PENDLE RELAX.
(STEPPING FORWARD) My thanks. May I ask whom we are addressing?
I am Tanapal. Abbot of the Brotherhood of the Black Petal.
Forgive me, your holiness — but I’m at a loss to understand why Brother Raspak here greets strangers not with kindness, but with spears and staves.
(STEPPING FORWARD) It is Brother Raspak’s duty to ensure our monastery’s security. On this occasion, it seems he may have exceeded himself.
(BRISTLING) It is not I who exceeds himself... Herbalist! Sticking your nose in where it’s not wanted, as usual —
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 25
(FIRM — NOT ANGRY) Silence, brothers.
THE TWO BECOME SILENT
Strangers are rare in this region. Tell me: where did you come from?
Well, your [holiness—]
(INTERRUPTING) As I have tried to explain, your eminence, my colleague and I are merchants, come from the cities of the East in search of new markets to sell our wares.
Unaccompanied?
They came with two ‘apprentice boys’, your holiness. I had them locked up.

Nonetheless... the few merchants we have met before brought with them pack animals, and had sherpas to guide them through the perilous mountain paths. (FISHING) Did you not leave a caravan, perhaps, somewhere on the moor?
(AWARE OF WHAT BOSWYCK IS DOING) Or perhaps we’re just travelling light.
But you were fortunate to find our monastery, without the help of local guides.
Ah, well—
(BUTTING IN) Kindly leave the talking to me. — As a matter of fact, your holiness, we were guided here. But not by sherpas.
Then how?
Do stop pussyfooting around, Pendle. — Abbot Tanapal: I don’t Suppose you know of any signal being sent from this monastery?
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 26
(SUDDENLY HARD — THE WORD’S HAD AN ELECTRIC EFFECT) Signal? What do you mean by ‘signal’? (BARKED) Speak!!!
(TERRIFIED) Summoned! We were summoned!
(WARNING) Pendle...! (TO ABBOT) Yes, we were summoned, in the manner of speaking. By — how to put it? By a strange reverberation in the ether!

(SMOOTHLY) Ah, I see it now. Your holiness — I believe that what these merchants are trying to tell us is that they were led here by the tolling of the tower bell, used to call the faithful to prayer.
(RELIEVED) The bell! Yes, yes, that was it! Exactly!
(DUHH!) The tolling of our bell couldn’t be heard in the cities of the east!
But the sound carries through the mountain passes, does it not? Indeed, I believe it to be amplified there.
That, Master Boswyck, I believe to be a sound observation. (TO TANAPAL) Your holiness — night draws on. Please, might we prevail on your hospitality, just for one evening?
(DECISIVELY) Raspak, have these merchants join their apprentices in the secure quarters.
‘Secure quarters’?
A cell is the only accommodation we have, even for honoured guests. (CLAPS HANDS) Take them away!
LEAD DOCTOR AND PENDLE OUT.
(LED AWAY) This is all wrong. We’re only merchants...
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 27
(TO TANAPAL) Perhaps if I might return to my duties, your holiness...?
Of course.
Begone, Boswyck.
EXITS QUICKLY, CLOSING LARGE WOODEN DOORS BEHIND HIM WITH A HEFTY THUD. BEAT. ALONE WITH RASPAK, TANAPAL’S VOICE
ANGRY AND URGENT.
These people are not merchants, Raspak.
No, master.
They have heard our signal. They are visitors from beyond this world.
Yes, master.
They cannot have landed in the mountains. Search the moors. Find the vessel they arrived in. Find it, and bring it here!
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 28
11: INT. CELL
CLATTER OF A KEY IN AN OLD LOCK. WOODEN DOOR CREAKS OPEN.
Doctor! Thank goodness.
Assessor Pendle — are you all right?
Thank you, guards. There’s no need to point the way with spears.
DOCTOR AND PENDLE TROOP IN. DOOR CLOSED AND LOCKED BEHIND.
You’ve not been harmed, then — either of you?
No thanks to the Doctor. Complicating matters with his talk of ‘signals’!
I think you’ll find that matters are already far more complicated than any of us would like, Mr Pendle.
Why? What did the Abbot say to you?

It was more what that he didn’t say. But he knows something about the subspace signal, that’s for certain. The guard captain Raspak, too. And I’m still bothered by that telepathic contact I experienced, on the moor...
Your ‘mental twinge’, you mean?
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 29
12: INT. OUTSIDE CELL [CONTINUOUS]
PRISONERS’ VOICES JUST AUDIBLE THROUGH DOOR AS BOSWYCK WALKS UP TO THE GUARD OUTSIDE — HABRILD.
(OFF) Pseudo-mystic fiddle-faddle!
(OFF; LOUDLY) Trust me, Mr Pendle. My instincts in these matters are rarely wrong.
(OFF; SCOFFING) Faugh!!!
(OFF) What was it, Doctor? This ‘twinge’?
(OFF) I’m convinced I felt a presence, Mrs Clarke. A living mental contact!
(OFF) Ssh, someone’s outside!
STOP OUTSIDE CELL.
Can I help you, Master Boswyck?
Guard Habrild. There is no need for you to stand sentry here.
But, Brother Raspak said...
I am Brother Raspak’s senior, and I would have you assist Allget the Unsteady in the kitchens.
(UNSURE) I —
Or would you rather clean out the garderobes? Now: give me the
keys. I shall be responsible for our guests.
Yes, Master Boswyck.
OVER JANGLING KEYS, THEN EXITS DOWN CORRIDOR. CROSS TO:
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 30
13: INT. CELL [CONTINUOUS]
CLATTER OF KEY IN LOCK. WOODEN DOOR CREAKS OPEN.
Ah. Master Boswyck, isn’t it? The herbalist.
I could not help but overhear what you were saying... ‘Doctor’.
Nasty habit, eavesdropping.
But enlightening. You say that you sensed a ‘presence’? In the monastery?
Around it, certainly.
Master Boswyck. Are we really the only strangers who’ve come here recently?
(AMUSED — HE KNOWS) Ah. One of the ‘boy apprentices’.
Look, we're not boys.
Asta, please, your disguise...
It doesn’t matter any more. It’s far more important that we get to the bottom of all this, and quickly.
Nonetheless, you should proceed discreetly. Some of the novices won’t ever have set eyes on a woman before.
Please, Master Boswyck. I asked you a question.
At the end of the last harvest, during the height of the autumn storms, a star was spotted in the southern sky. But as it drew closer, it became clear that this was no natural phenomenon.
A spacecraft.

ROSCO: THE TWO BOYS HURRY OUT.
ROSCO: ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 21
DISTANT: BELL CONTINUES AS DOCTOR, CONSTANCE, PENDLE AND ASTA ARRIVE AT THE MONASTERY GATES.
CONSTANCE: Imposing gates, aren’t they?
DOCTOR: A symphony in carved flowers. As I said, the Brotherhood are
DOCTOR: master craftsmen.
CONSTANCE: Yes, but gates this size usually mean one thing:
DOCTOR: They do?
ASTA: “Keep out.”
CONSTANCE: So how do we get in — knock?
PENDLE: You will do no such thing. Asta — please relate the first principle of first contact?
ASTA: “We must make our presence known in a non-aggressive way.”
PENDLE: Now, [watch as I attempt to do just that...]
OVER THIS: CLATTER OF BOLTS BEING DRAWN...
CONSTANCE: I don’t think that will be necessary.
CONSTANCE: . AND THE GATES OF THE MONASTERY BEGIN TO OPEN.
ASTA: The gates are opening!
PENDLE: Now then. Leave all the talking to me. These are simple people...
RASPAK: (OFF) There they are. Present arms!
A DOZEN NOVICES: (PRESENT ARMS WITH A NOISY HAKA-LIKE CRY) Ha!!!
A DOZEN NOVICES: ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 22
CONSTANCE: Simple people with staffs and spears...
PENDLE: (STEPPING FORWARD) Greetings, gentle brothers, we are merchants...
RASPAK: (OFF) Seize them!
A DOZEN NOVICES: (CHARGE FORWARD, OVERWHELMING THE GROUP) Raaaaaaaaaaaaaa-!
NOVICES: CHARGE FORWARD. SCUFFLING.
PENDLE: (GRABBED) Now really, there is no need for this aggression!
ASTA: (GRABBED) Ah!
CONSTANCE: (GRABBED) Do you mind!
RASPAK: Cease! (STEPPING FORWARD) Speak! — why have you come?
PENDLE: My c-colleague and I are humble merchants, nothing more.
RASPAK: Then why do the two in the cloaks hide their faces with hoods?
PENDLE: EY...
CONSTANCE: (LOWERING HOOD) As you see, we’ve nothing to hide.
DOCTOR: (HASTILY) These two... er, boys, are our apprentices. I assure you, they’re quite harmless!
RASPAK: That’s for the Abbot to decide. (TO HIS MEN) You men: lock these... apprentice boys in one of the cells. —
RASPAK: ASTA AND CONSTANCE ARE BUNDLED AWAY.
RASPAK: ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 23
CONSTANCE: (AS SHE’S BUNDLED AWAY) You’ve seized us already, there’s no
CONSTANCE: need to drag us —
RASPAK: You others: these so-called ‘merchants’ are coming with me!
RASPAK: DOCTOR AND PENDLE ARE DRAGGED OFF IN ANOTHER DIRECTION.
PENDLE: (DRAGGED) Oh, mercy!
DOCTOR: It is so enlightening watching a master of first contact at work.
DOCTOR: ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 24
DOCTOR: FADE UP GENTLE TINKLING OF WINDCHIMES IN THE BACKGROUND.
OVERALL: CALM ATMOS. SCUFFLING FROM OFF AS 4 x NOVICES DRAG THE DOCTOR AND PENDLE IN.
PENDLE: (OFF) Oh, do be careful...
DOCTOR: (OFF) There really is no need to manhandle us like this...
RASPAK: Halt!
ALL: STOP — SCUFFLING CEASES.
TANAPAL: Raspak? What is this noise?
RASPAK: I apologise for disturbing the peace of your chamber, holy one, but these are the strangers.
TANAPAL: Guards — release your grip.
TANAPAL: DOCTOR AND PENDLE RELAX.
DOCTOR: (STEPPING FORWARD) My thanks. May I ask whom we are addressing?
TANAPAL: I am Tanapal. Abbot of the Brotherhood of the Black Petal.
DOCTOR: Forgive me, your holiness — but I’m at a loss to understand why Brother Raspak here greets strangers not with kindness, but with spears and staves.
BOSWYCK: (STEPPING FORWARD) It is Brother Raspak’s duty to ensure our monastery’s security. On this occasion, it seems he may have exceeded himself.
RASPAK: (BRISTLING) It is not I who exceeds himself... Herbalist! Sticking your nose in where it’s not wanted, as usual —
RASPAK: ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 25
TANAPAL: (FIRM — NOT ANGRY) Silence, brothers.
TANAPAL: Strangers are rare in this region. Tell me: where did you come from?
DOCTOR: Well, your [holiness—]
PENDLE: (INTERRUPTING) As I have tried to explain, your eminence, my colleague and I are merchants, come from the cities of the East in search of new markets to sell our wares.
TANAPAL: Unaccompanied?
RASPAK: They came with two ‘apprentice boys’, your holiness. I had them locked up.
BOSWYCK: Nonetheless... the few merchants we have met before brought with them pack animals, and had sherpas to guide them through the perilous mountain paths. (FISHING) Did you not leave a caravan, perhaps, somewhere on the moor?
DOCTOR: (AWARE OF WHAT BOSWYCK IS DOING) Or perhaps we’re just travelling light.
TANAPAL: But you were fortunate to find our monastery, without the help of local guides.
DOCTOR: Ah, well—
PENDLE: (BUTTING IN) Kindly leave the talking to me. — As a matter of fact, your holiness, we were guided here. But not by sherpas.
TANAPAL: Then how?
DOCTOR: Do stop pussyfooting around, Pendle. — Abbot Tanapal: I don’t Suppose you know of any signal being sent from this monastery?
DOCTOR: ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 26
TANAPAL: (SUDDENLY HARD — THE WORD’S HAD AN ELECTRIC EFFECT) Signal? What do you mean by ‘signal’? (BARKED) Speak!!!
PENDLE: (TERRIFIED) Summoned! We were summoned!
DOCTOR: (WARNING) Pendle...! (TO ABBOT) Yes, we were summoned, in the manner of speaking. By — how to put it? By a strange reverberation in the ether!
BOSWYCK: (SMOOTHLY) Ah, I see it now. Your holiness — I believe that what these merchants are trying to tell us is that they were led here by the tolling of the tower bell, used to call the faithful to prayer.
PENDLE: (RELIEVED) The bell! Yes, yes, that was it! Exactly!
RASPAK: (DUHH!) The tolling of our bell couldn’t be heard in the cities of the east!
BOSWYCK: But the sound carries through the mountain passes, does it not? Indeed, I believe it to be amplified there.
DOCTOR: That, Master Boswyck, I believe to be a sound observation. (TO TANAPAL) Your holiness — night draws on. Please, might we prevail on your hospitality, just for one evening?
TANAPAL: (DECISIVELY) Raspak, have these merchants join their apprentices in the secure quarters.
DOCTOR: ‘Secure quarters’?
TANAPAL: A cell is the only accommodation we have, even for honoured guests. (CLAPS HANDS) Take them away!
NOVICES: LEAD DOCTOR AND PENDLE OUT.
PENDLE: (LED AWAY) This is all wrong. We’re only merchants...
PENDLE: ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 27
BOSWYCK: (TO TANAPAL) Perhaps if I might return to my duties, your holiness...?
TANAPAL: Of course.
RASPAK: Begone, Boswyck.
BOSWYCK: EXITS QUICKLY, CLOSING LARGE WOODEN DOORS BEHIND HIM WITH A HEFTY THUD. BEAT. ALONE WITH RASPAK, TANAPAL’S VOICE
BECOMES: ANGRY AND URGENT.
TANAPAL: These people are not merchants, Raspak.
RASPAK: No, master.
TANAPAL: They have heard our signal. They are visitors from beyond this world.
RASPAK: Yes, master.
TANAPAL: They cannot have landed in the mountains. Search the moors. Find the vessel they arrived in. Find it, and bring it here!
TANAPAL: ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 28
TANAPAL: CLATTER OF A KEY IN AN OLD LOCK. WOODEN DOOR CREAKS OPEN.
CONSTANCE: Doctor! Thank goodness.
ASTA: Assessor Pendle — are you all right?
DOCTOR: Thank you, guards. There’s no need to point the way with spears.
DOCTOR: DOCTOR AND PENDLE TROOP IN. DOOR CLOSED AND LOCKED BEHIND.
ASTA: You’ve not been harmed, then — either of you?
PENDLE: No thanks to the Doctor. Complicating matters with his talk of ‘signals’!
DOCTOR: I think you’ll find that matters are already far more complicated than any of us would like, Mr Pendle.
CONSTANCE: Why? What did the Abbot say to you?
DOCTOR: It was more what that he didn’t say. But he knows something about the subspace signal, that’s for certain. The guard captain Raspak, too. And I’m still bothered by that telepathic contact I experienced, on the moor...
CONSTANCE: Your ‘mental twinge’, you mean?
CROSS TO: ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 29
CROSS TO: PRISONERS’ VOICES JUST AUDIBLE THROUGH DOOR AS BOSWYCK WALKS UP TO THE GUARD OUTSIDE — HABRILD.
PENDLE: (OFF) Pseudo-mystic fiddle-faddle!
DOCTOR: (OFF; LOUDLY) Trust me, Mr Pendle. My instincts in these matters are rarely wrong.
PENDLE: (OFF; SCOFFING) Faugh!!!
CONSTANCE: (OFF) What was it, Doctor? This ‘twinge’?
DOCTOR: (OFF) I’m convinced I felt a presence, Mrs Clarke. A living mental contact!
ASTA: (OFF) Ssh, someone’s outside!
FOOTSTEPS: STOP OUTSIDE CELL.
HABRILD: Can I help you, Master Boswyck?
BOSWYCK: Guard Habrild. There is no need for you to stand sentry here.
HABRILD: But, Brother Raspak said...
BOSWYCK: I am Brother Raspak’s senior, and I would have you assist Allget the Unsteady in the kitchens.
HABRILD: (UNSURE) I —
BOSWYCK: Or would you rather clean out the garderobes? Now: give me the
BOSWYCK: keys. I shall be responsible for our guests.
HABRILD: Yes, Master Boswyck.
HANDS: OVER JANGLING KEYS, THEN EXITS DOWN CORRIDOR. CROSS TO:
HANDS: ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 30
HANDS: CLATTER OF KEY IN LOCK. WOODEN DOOR CREAKS OPEN.
DOCTOR: Ah. Master Boswyck, isn’t it? The herbalist.
BOSWYCK: I could not help but overhear what you were saying... ‘Doctor’.
DOCTOR: Nasty habit, eavesdropping.
BOSWYCK: But enlightening. You say that you sensed a ‘presence’? In the monastery?
DOCTOR: Around it, certainly.
CONSTANCE: Master Boswyck. Are we really the only strangers who’ve come here recently?
BOSWYCK: (AMUSED — HE KNOWS) Ah. One of the ‘boy apprentices’.
ASTA: Look, we're not boys.
PENDLE: Asta, please, your disguise...
ASTA: It doesn’t matter any more. It’s far more important that we get to the bottom of all this, and quickly.
BOSWYCK: Nonetheless, you should proceed discreetly. Some of the novices won’t ever have set eyes on a woman before.
CONSTANCE: Please, Master Boswyck. I asked you a question.
BOSWYCK: At the end of the last harvest, during the height of the autumn storms, a star was spotted in the southern sky. But as it drew closer, it became clear that this was no natural phenomenon.
DOCTOR: A spacecraft.
DOCTOR: ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 31
BOSWYCK: Indeed. It crashed in the fields to the east. The fireball lit up the sky for miles.
ASTA: (PLEASED WITH HERSELF) I knew that signal had to be of off- world origin.
BOSWYCK: Our order is sworn to protect the sanctity of all life — even if that life is not of our world — so we ventured out to see what could be done to help.
DOCTOR: There were survivors, weren’t there?
BOSWYCK: Many had died, but yes, some had survived the crash. We brought them and the remains of their vessel back to the monastery. We nursed them back to health as best we could, though these were beings unlike anything we had ever encountered...
PENDLE: (GROANS) Oh, no. Oh no, no, no. A grade three planet exposed to grade one technology. Do you have any idea how much paperwork there’1ll be?
ASTA: So the signal we heard, that came from the crashed ship?
BOSWYCK: The creatures tried to show us how to repair their machinery, but their craft was badly damaged. Their, er, t-t-t.. (SEARCHES FOR THE WORD)
CONSTANCE: Transmitter?
BOSWYCK: That’s right. Their transmitter is within the walls, but the Signal it produces is very weak.
PENDLE: And the creatures themselves? They’re still here?
BOSWYCK: They stay near the remains of their craft. They work night and day, aided by the Abbot’s personal guard. But they work in secret. The few assisting them have sworn never to speak of what they see or do.
BOSWYCK: ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 32
PENDLE: But this is appalling! To show such contempt of accepted protocol, to involve the populace in such a manner! We shall need forms, Asta, lots and lots of forms.
DOCTOR: The occupants of that craft crashed, Pendle! I’m sure they’ve been thinking only of their own survival...
BOSWYCK: (SIGHS) Ah, if only that were true. Sadly these creatures have more than just survival on their minds...
DOCTOR: Oh?
BOSWYCK: I believe that the Abbot is under the influence of these creatures, that they are controlling him for some malign purpose. — Doctor, you said that you sensed a presence. I have been praying for help to come to our monastery. Perhaps my prayers have been answered...
DOCTOR: (SCEPTICAL) I’d not go that far, Master Boswyck. But I think you'd better take us to these troublesome visitors of yours, don’t you?
BOSWYCK: Follow me.
ALL EXIT INTO: ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 33
ALL EXIT INTO: AS BOSWYCK LEADS THE DOCTOR AND THE OTHERS OUTSIDE...
BOSWYCK: The creatures confine themselves to the East Range.
ROSCO: (RUNNING UP) Master Boswyck! Master Boswyck!
BOSWYCK: Rosco. What is it now?
ROSCO: I had to find you. Raspak has taken guards to fetch the strangers’ caravan, and bring it back to the monastery!
BOSWYCK: (ANGRY) I thought I told you to say nothing...
ROSCO: (INTERRUPTING) Not the box. A strange shiny caravan. Two of the Brothers returning from the Black Valley reported seeing it on the moor!
ASTA: Oh no...
PENDLE: Our shuttle. This is terrible news. Terrible!
CONSTANCE: I’m sure it’s not as bad as all that.
PENDLE: Not that bad! Do you have any idea of the cultural pollution it might cause?
ASTA: He’s right. The shuttle is packed with anachronisms. Communications devices, star maps, a food synthesisev...
DOCTOR: But only if the monks gain entry to your ship. I can’t believe you were foolish enough to leave it unlocked?
PENDLE: Of course not!
CONSTANCE: Well then. Surely the damage will be limited.
CONSTANCE: ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 34
ASTA: But it’s our responsibility. We have to ensure that the ship is secure. Ideally remove it from the scene.
PENDLE: Well, then, Asta — you’1ll have to go. Take this Mrs Clarke with you, if you must.
ASTA: You forget, sir: I’m not a qualified pilot.
DOCTOR: (SIGHS) Right, I’ll go. You three stay here, I’1ll be as quick as I can.
PENDLE: Out of the question! I can’t allow you to wander around a grade three planet unsupervised!
ASTA: Well the solution is obvious then, isn’t it?
DOCTOR: It is?
ASTA: There are two of us and two of you. You and Assessor Pendle secure and remove the shuttle, while I investigate the aliens with Mrs Clarke.
PENDLE: Probationary Assessor Asta, if you really [think—]
ASTA: (INTERUPTING) Probationary Assessor, exactly. Such a mission would be the ideal way for you to assess my suitability to become a full Assessor. That, after all, is the point of my being here.
PENDLE: Well, yes, I suppose. But you will observe these aliens only. Make unsupervised contact and I shall be obliged to fail you!
ASTA: Fine by me.
CONSTANCE: Well, that seems to have settled that.
BOSWYCK: Rosco, will you show the Doctor and this man Pendle how they may access the moor without passing through the main gate?
BOSWYCK: ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 35
ROSCO: (NERVOUS) Me, Master Boswyck? Consort with demons?
BOSWYCK: As I’ve already explained to you, Rosco, these people are strangers, nothing more. You have nothing to fear from them.
DOCTOR: Indeed. My bark is worse than my bite, I assure you. And Pendle here’s a pussycat really — aren’t you, Pendle?
ROSCO: (THINKS) Alright, then. This way.
DOCTOR: (QUIETLY) Mrs Clarke — although I have absolute faith in your abilities, I presume you’re happy with this arrangement?
CONSTANCE: Perfectly happy. Observation only, then we’ll retire.
DOCTOR: As soon as the shuttle’s secure, we’ll come and find you.
PENDLE: Doctor, if you’re quite finished...?
CONSTANCE: Good luck.
DOCTOR: Right, young man. Lead on.
DOCTOR: DOCTOR, PENDLE AND ROSCO HEAD OFF - LEFT.
CONSTANCE: The East Range, you said, Master Boswyck?
BOSWYCK: If anyone should challenge us, let me do the talking. This way.
BOSWYCK: CONSTANCE, ASTA AND BOSWYCK HEAD OFF — RIGHT. FADE.
BOSWYCK: ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 36
BOSWYCK: FADE UP. FAINT ‘ORGANIC HEARTBEAT’ FROM OFF. BOSWYCK, CONSTANCE AND ASTA RUN UP.
BOSWYCK: The aliens’ chamber is through here. Usually it’s guarded, but doubtless Raspak has got all the bodies he can out collecting this ‘caravan’.
ASTA: (SNIFFING THE AIR) What is that awful smell?
CONSTANCE: Meat. It’s like a butcher’s market.
BOSWYCK: Hoods up, perhaps? — Now, quietly!
BOSWYCK: JANGLE OF KEYS. KEY IN LOCK. CREAK OF WOODEN DOOR OPENING AS
ALL THREE ENTER INTO: ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 37
ALL THREE ENTER INTO: IN B/G IS ORGANIC HEARTBEAT-STYLE THROB HEARD IN SCENE 2 — SIMILAR IN TEMPO TO THE ‘DALEK CONTROL ROOM’ NOISE. BOSWYCK
CLOSES: DOOR. SLIGHTLY HUSHED VOICES.
BOSWYCK: Observe, yonder. That is how the injured creatures have been kept alive.
ASTA: What? In bags, hanging from the rafters?
CONSTANCE: They’re not bags. That smell, it’s obvious! They’re stomachs.
BOSWYCK: You are quite correct. They are stomachs cut from two Brandelak, repurposed as wombs for the creatures to rest in.
ASTA: That’s horrible!
CONSTANCE: MOVES FORWARD.
CONSTANCE: Like the Doctor said, it’s survival. The best they could do in the circumstances...
ASTA: Constance. Don’t get too close.
CONSTANCE: You can actually see one of the creatures moving about, through the wall of the stomach. Look, it’s turning over and around.
ASTA: It’s my stomach that’s turning over and around.
BOSWYCK: Strange — someone’s knocked a hole in the far wall, to connect this chamber to the next.
CONSTANCE: So.. what are you saying?
BOSWYCK: There may be someone through there. Back into the corridor, hurry!
SUDDENLY: — A DALEK GLIDES INTO THE CHAMBER FROM OFF.

17: INT. DALEKS’ CHAMBER [CONTINUOUS]
What in heaven’s name is it, this ‘Dalek’?
#1: Do not move! — Obey! Obey!!!
(ANXIOUS) Constance. Don’t move.
You really are terrified, aren’t you? Boswyck too.
(SOTTO, CALM) Of course we are.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 40
It’s a Dalek! A vicious killing machine! How can you not know what it is?
I thought it was something made by the monks. I’ve never seen stained glass and leadwork used in such a manner before. It’s like a mobile work of art.
The monks must have built it a new casing.
It’s rather beautiful. (TO DALEK) May I take a closer look?
#1: Stay where you are!!!
Please do as it says, Mrs Clarke. It won’t hesitate to kill you. (TO DALEK) Master, if you would allow me to explain...?
A SECOND DALEK ENTERS THE CHAMBER.
Look, there’s another one.
#1: These humanoids are unauthorised in this sector.
#2: Explain...!
These two novices are in my charge, master. New apprentices. I am training them to take care of the sleeping ones. They need to learn how to keep them healthy.
#1: Explanation satisfactory. You may proceed.
#2: No. Nutrient levels are running below optimum levels. The humanoids must fetch more.
Yes, master. Immediately, master. As you command. — Come along, boys.
HE BUSTLES CONSTANCE AND ASTA OUT OF THE CHAMBER, INTO:
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 41
18: INT. CORRIDOR [CONTINUOUS]
CLOSES BEHIND THEM, SHUTTING OFF THE HEARTBEAT SOUND.
I still don’t understand what these ‘Daleks’ are doing here.
Nor me. We have to find Assessor Pendle. We have to let the Census know!
Never mind that now. What was all that about ‘nutrients’?
(GRIM) I shall show you...
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 42
19: EXT. BALCONY OVERLOOKING COURTYARD
THE SOUND OF MANY MONKS GRUNTING AND HEAVING, MINGLED WITH THE MOOING AND SNORTING OF THE BRANDELAKS, AS THE
IS DRAGGED INTO THE COURTYARD.
(FROM BELOW) Heave! (EFFORT) Heave! (EFFORT) [ETC UNTIL
(FROM BELOW) Hold those beasts steady! Bring the thing in slowly, we don’t want to damage it.
DOCTOR, ROSCO AND PENDLE ARE HIDDEN AND WATCHING. SOTTO VOICES.
We’re too late. Raspak’s men are bringing in the machine.
My shuttle! — Doctor, what are we going to do?
For the moment, there’s nothing we can do but watch and wait.
But have they managed to breach the hull?
So far as I can see it’s still intact.
Then perhaps we are worrying unduly.
(FROM BELOW) Cease!
STOPS.
(FROM BELOW) Master blacksmith! Come forward!
Blacksmith...?
Beefy fellow, isn’t he?
(FROM BELOW) Blacksmith — the Abbot asks you to test your tools against the hull of this vessel.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 43
What an enormous hammer he’s got.
It’s used for shoeing Sleem.
What are ‘Sleem’?
(FROM BELOW) Everyone stand back, give him room to work!
A SERIES OF COLOSSAL CLANGS AS THE BLACKSMITH SWINGS HIS HAMMER AT THE SHIP.
I hope you’ve got very comprehensive insurance, Mr Pendle, that’s going to leave quite a dent...
My ship! (HE SIGHS) Still, if that’s the most sophisticated form of entry they’re going to try...
CLANGS AS THE BLACKSMITH STRIKES THE SHIP AGAIN AND AGAIN.
THERE IS AN ELECTRONIC ALARM NOISE.
Saints preserve us, what is that noise?
Oh no... He’s managed to trigger the mechanism on a fuel access panel.
What are we going to do?
We must stop them, for their own safety as well as ours!
If you go down into the courtyard, demon, Raspak will surely kill you.
GOES UP A PITCH.
We’ve no choice. Rosco, go and tell Boswyck what’s happened.
Go!
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 44
20. EXT. COURTYARD [CONTINUOUS]
Disregard that sound. Continue, master blacksmith!
CLANGING AS THE BLACKSMITH STRIKES THE SHIP.
(RUSHING IN FROM OFF) I really wouldn’t do that if I were you...
Wha... — Seize those two!
AS DOCTOR AND PENDLE ARE SEIZED BY THE GUARDS.
This really is becoming most tiresome.
(EXASPERATED) We are trying to help you!
(SCORNFUL) Help? How can you help us?
By preventing you from doing something stupid. Hear that alarm? If Brother Schwarzenegger there were to rupture a fuel line, he could reduce this monastery to a smoke hole in the ground.
You think that because we lead a simple life, that we are stupid? The ship is of no use to us if we damage its propulsion system.
Well, then!
Fetch a smaller hammer, Master Blacksmith.
STOPS.
I.. I don’t understand. You shouldn’t have any knowledge of such matters.
Oh, I think it’s obvious that our alien crash victims have interfered with this culture rather more directly that we had hoped. They have introduced the concept of higher technology.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 45
They have passed on great knowledge!
But this is outrageous!
And we are fast learners. Guards — take these two to the Abbot. He shall decide their fate!
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 46
21: INT. DALEKS’ CHAMBER
THROB CONTINUES IN THE BACKGROUND.
#1: Humanoid slaves have located alien space vehicle and transported it to this location.
#2: Have they been able to penetrate the hull?
#1: Negative. Primitive tools are proving ineffective.
Lack of technology on this planet is hampering Dalek operations. Acquisition of energy weapons must become top priority.
#1: Agreed. I will instruct slaves to increase efforts to breach hull.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 47
22: INT. ABBOT’S CHAMBER
FADE UP. DOCTOR AND PENDLE ARE DRAGGED BEFORE THE ABBOT ONCE MORE.
The merchants. Our hospitality was not to your liking?
When you’ve seen one cell, your holiness, you’ve seen ‘em all.
Where are your companions?
At this very moment they are making a report to my superiors.
How? Your communication devices are inside your ship.
It does not matter. They will be caught. Now you will give me the access codes to open your ship.
I most certainly will not.
Give me the codes! Your technology is all we require.
That’s what that signal’s for, isn’t it? It’s a lure. Like the Sirens of ancient mythology, you’ve been sending out a signal, hoping to lure some poor unwary traveller onto the rocks.
With the restrictions placed upon this world, no-one would answer the call. Only the proper authorities. Only... you.
How can you know of such things? You’re only a primitive people...
Oh, I think that the Abbot here is far from primitive — hm?
What do you mean by — [that?] (CUT SHORT, GASPS IN PAIN) Aah!
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 48
SIMULTANEOUSLY, THE DOCTOR ALSO CLUTCHES AT HIS HEAD. THE SAME ‘TWINGE’ HE FELT OUTSIDE THE MONASTERY — BUT STRONGER.
Ah!
What’s wrong now?
Another contact. Another twinge, only stronger than before. — Tanapal, if there’s something you want to tell us...?
(REGAINS HIS COMPOSURE) There is nothing. (BEAT) I said your technology alone was of use to us. But we require nutrients too.
‘Nutrients’?
The brothers donate much, but they cannot afford to be generous. You can. (CLAPS HANDS) Guards - take them to the chapel!
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 49
23: INT. CHAPEL/STAIRS TO BALCONY/BALCONY
CREAKS OPEN. BOSWYCK LEADS CONSTANCE AND ASTA INTO THE CHAPEL. BIG EMPTY SPACE.
NB: SOTTO VOICES THROUGHOUT.
What is this? A chapel? I hardly think this is the moment for prayers. (THINKS) Then again, if these Daleks are as bad as
Assessor Asta claims...
They are.
Up the stairs to the balcony, quickly.
THE THREE OF THEM CLIMB THE STAIRS. AS THEY CLIMB THEY TALK.
(CLIMBING) Why?
(CLIMBING) You wanted to know where the nutrients came from,
didn’t you?
(CLIMBING) Yes, but...
(CLIMBING) I’m showing you.
THEY REACH THE TOP.
Here we are. Look down into the chapel. What do you see?
Brothers, kneeling down before the altar.
One of them has a chalice. Is it a communion?
An unholy one.
Now that one’s bringing out — wait, is that a syringe?
I believe it is.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 50
Why would they need syringes at a.. (TRAILS OFF)
BEAT
Because they’re siphoning their blood into the chalice.
That’s horrible!
The creatures demand that each member of our order donates a little blood each day, in order to keep these creatures alive.
The Doctor needs to see this.
CHAPEL DOORS BANG OPEN AS DOCTOR AND PENDLE ARE DRAGGED IN.
(BELOW) Unhand us!
(BELOW) Raspak, this is totally unnecessary!
I think he’s about to.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 51
24. INT. CHAPEL [CONTINUOUS]
Oh, I see. The ‘nutrient’ the Abbot spoke of. You want our blood!
The brothers willingly donate what little they can. I expect you and your friend to donate a whole lot more.
Don’t be a fool, Raspak. Can’t you see you’re being used?
No, it is you who will be used. Now kneel and make your offering.
Do something, Doctor!!!
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 52
25: INT. BALCONY [CONTINUOUS]
NB: SOTTO VOICES.
We have to do something.
There are too many of them.
We can’t just watch them leached!
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 53
26: INT. CHAPEL [CONTINUOUS]
BANGS AS HABRILD HURRIES INTO THE CHAPEL.
Raspak! Raspak!!!
(IRRITATED) What is it, Habrild?
We’ve found something. On the moor. Another of the strangers’ caravans. A blue box!
(SIGHS) Just when I thought things couldn’t get any worse...
It’s being brought into the courtyard now.
I must inform the Abbot. Take over here. Drain the curly-haired one white while his colleague watches. Perhaps that will make him a little more cooperative.
But — I can’t bear the sight of blood!
Poor you, Pendle. It’s not your blood they’1l be draining!
(AS HE DEPARTS) I will return shortly.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 54
27: INT. BALCONY [CONTINUOUS]
There’s just three of them with the Doctor and Pendle now.
So this is our chance.
What are you intending?
(RUSHING OFF) Something. Anything!
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 55
28: INT. CHAPEL [CONTINUOUS]
IS FORCED TO HIS KNEES AT THE ALTAR.
Ow! (TO GUARD) Many modern places of worship provide cushions for your knees. I hope you’re going to sterilise that needle.
How can you be so flippant!
You can catch all sorts of things off a dirty needle, you know. Lockjaw, tetanus, not to mention staphylococcal infections. — Oh good, they’re taking it away.
Yes, but they’re fetching a knife...!
Ah.
SUDDENLY, FROM BEHIND:
Excuse me, chaps, I don’t suppose any of you could point my friend and I in the direction of the ladies’ room?
(SHOCKED) Women? But... women are not allowed here.
What a medieval attitude.
Brothers, seize those women! Raspak will want to question them!
(COMING UP BEHIND CONSTANCE AND ASTA) No, novice Habrild. These strangers are in my charge.
Master Boswyck. You sent me to the kitchens when I was not needed! I think these demons have you under their spell!
We’re not demons.
Demons, women — what’s the difference?
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 56
Perhaps, if I might intervene? Guard — perhaps you could reach inside my colleague Mr Pendle’s bag...?
Wait. Why...?
There you’ll find a small brown box, with a strap.
DIGGING IN PENDLE’S BAG.
Your ‘Box Brownie’? But —
There, that’s it. Go on, novice Habrild. Take it.
(TAKING IT) Why? What is it?
It’s a portable demon detector. Look through the viewfinder — the glass eye. Point it at the women, then press the button on the top.
BROWNIE SHUTTER CLICKS.
Now what?
Now, we have to send the film to be developed. It might take a week.
A week? Then what use is that?
What use? Well, it has distracted you long enough to enable Master Boswyck to sneak around your guards —
GUARDS’ HEADS KNOCKED TOGETHER. CLONKED. FALL TO FLOOR.
. and knock their heads together. Thank you, Master Boswyck.
Master Boswyck? Then these demons have compelled you...!
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 57
Habrild, you’re an idiot. If you really do believe these women to be demons...
. then why have you turned your back on us?
(TURNING) Whuh?
EFFORT — PUNCHES HABRILD ON THE JAW
REACTS — THEN FALLS TO FLOOR, UNCONSCIOUS
Well done, Asta.
Ow! His jaw was really hard...
(OUTRAGE) Probationary assessor Asta, I am appalled! “We must make our presence known in a non-aggressive way” — remember?
I was saving your life, sir!
Exactly. Thank you, Asta. You too, Mrs Clarke. A few more moments...
Doctor. The aliens. The crash survivors. We’ve met them.
They’re Daleks!
(AGHAST) Daleks!!!
Why, have you heard of them before?
But this is terrible news! Terrible! We shall all be killed.
(GRIM) How many of them are there?
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 58
We saw two, but there are at least another two being kept alive inside animal carcasses.
Our ‘nutrients’ were meant for them, no doubt.
Please. The guards will wake soon. It’s not safe to stay here.
I should say not, Master Boswyck.
Follow me, we’ll hide in my chambers.
THEY HURRY OFF AFTER BOSWYCK.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 59
29: EXT. COURTYARD
RASPAK AND TANAPAL ENTER THE COURTYARD.
See, your holiness? Another vessel found on the moorland. Although how a box such as this may fly, I cannot imagine...
But I can. I know this object, Brother Raspak! (BEAT; REALISATION) But that means...
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 60
30: INT. BOSWYCK’S QUARTERS
FADE UP. DOCTOR, CONSTANCE, PENDLE AND ASTA HURRY INSIDE.
Hurry, all of you!
CLOSES THE DOOR BEHIND THEM.
The alarm may be raised at any moment. I doubt I can conceal you for long.
That’s the least of our problems. On a world like this, we’re just not equipped to fight Daleks.
If it’s any consolation, I don’t know that they’re equipped to fight us. They didn’t seem to have any energy weapons, just spikes where their guns should be.
Spikes?!
The brothers have built the creatures new casings, from materials to hand.
What ‘materials’?
Bent lead and stained glass. I thought them rather beautiful.
I need to see these ‘beautiful’ Daleks.
They’11 kill you on sight!
Then I’d better make sure that they don’t see me, hadn’t I? — Master Boswyck, I don’t suppose you could lend me some robes?
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 61
31: INT. CHAPEL
BANGS AS RASPAK AND THE ABBOT HURRY INTO THE CHAPEL.
You are sure, Raspak? One of the merchants called the other ‘Doctor’?
Certain, your holiness. Why, is it important?
If that is the case, he cannot die yet. Not before we have questioned him—
HE BREAKS OFF, SEEING THE EMPTY ALTAR.
Where is he? Where is the Doctor, and his companion?
I — I do not know. Novice Habrild? What happened here?
(GROANING) Raspak. There were demons here...
Demons?
Worse, two of them were... were women. (FAINTS AGAIN)
Wake up, you fool!
Leave him. Raise the alarm, Raspak. The Doctor and his associates must be located!
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 62
32: INT. CORRIDOR
FADE UP. BOSWYCK LEADS DOCTOR, CONSTANCE, PENDLE AND ASTA ALONG.
Really, I wish you’d all stayed behind in Boswyck’s quarters. It’d be far better for me to proceed alone.
Having gone to all the trouble of rescuing you, I’m not letting you out of my sight.
I feel a lot safer, staying together like this.
Agreed.
4 x MONKS RUSHING NOISILY, IN THE NEXT CORRIDOR.
Quiet!
(WELL OFF) Search everywhere, brothers! The Abbot commands the strangers must be found!
THE FOOTSTEPS RECEDE.
You hear that? They’re searching the monastery.
Then how are we going to get to the East Range unseen?
There is a secret passageway.
That’s handy.
There are many secret tunnels in the monastery. A relic of more violent times when our brothers had to hide from soldiers of the state. Here, help me with this tapestry.
HEAVY TAPESTRY ASIDE THROUGH:
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 63

I arranged to have this entrance covered up, after Rosco and Gabber sneaked inside, wanting to see the visitors from the stars for themselves. Gabber came face-to-face with one of the creatures in its naked form. He has not spoken since...
Their naked form?
It’s not pleasant.
Hold the tapestry firm while I unlock the door.
BEGINS TO UNLOCK DOOR.
This passage leads directly to the Dalek workshop?
Indeed. But we must be careful. The Dalek creatures use these passages to travel through the monastery undetected.
In which case, I really must insist that I proceed [alone. ]
THIS, MORE RUSHING FOOTSTEPS FROM OFF.
I hear more guards!
They’re coming this way!
Everyone, inside the passageway, now!
AS EVERYONE BUNDLES INSIDE THE PASSAGEWAY :
But—
No arguing, Doctor. There’s nothing else to be done!
‘FLUMPS’ HEAVILY BACK OVER DOORWAY.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 64
33: INT. SECRET PASSAGEWAY
FADE UP. BOSWYCK LEADS DOCTOR, CONSTANCE, PENDLE AND ASTA ALONG.
Stay close. There are many junctions and dead ends. I got lost in here for days once, when I was a mere novice.
You’re a man after my own heart, Boswyck. The tunnels beneath the Panopticon on Gallifrey were [my playground, too —]
Is this really the time for boyhood reminiscences!
[Oh, once he gets going...]
— 2 x DALEKS IN MOTION ALONG STONE FLOOR.
(HISSED) Will you all be quiet! (HUSHED) I think I hear something at the junction ahead.
BEAT, SO WE CAN HEAR APPROACHING DALEKS.
(HUSHED) You’re right, coming along one of the other tunnels.
(HUSHED) Quickly, everyone. Back against the wall. Stay silent.
PRESSES THEMSELVES AGAINST THE WALL. THE TWO DALEKS
DOWN THE CORRIDOR.
#1: (APPROACHING) Why have been been ordered to leave the construction work?
#2: (APPROACHING) We are instructed to join the Black Dalek.
#1: (CLOSEST) Construction of the remaining casings will be
delayed. More Dalek units must be made operational.
#2: (RECEDING) Orders of the Black Dalek take priority. Proceed!
RECEDE DOWN THE CORRIDOR. BEAT.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 65
(EXHALING) Oh, my heart. I felt certain that they would discover us.
Well, I see what you mean about their new casings. Very snazzy.
I wonder where they were off to in such a hurry?
(THOUGHTFULLY) Yes, I wonder...
Never mind that. By the sound of it, they’ve left their workshop unguarded.
Indeed. We should make the most of this happy situation.
THEY HURRY DOWN THE PASSAGEWAY.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL)
34: INT. ABBOT’S CHAMBERS
MARCHES IN.
Page 66
Your holiness. The brothers are searching every part of the
monastery. I promise you, this Doctor will not escape.
Raspak. You have allowed him to escape twice already!
He had help. Not just the women. Master Boswyck, too,
The herbalist!
I’ve long had my doubts about Boswyck...
None shall escape. I shall ensure it.
GRINDING OF SECRET PASSAGEWAY BEHIND.
How, your holiness?
I’m told.
I have called for assistance! (CLAPS HANDS) Brother Daleks —
enter!
x 2: (EXITING PASSAGEWAY) We proceed...!
You understand the situation? The Doctor is here.
#1: The Doctor is an enemy of the Daleks.
#2: He will seek to sabotage Dalek operations.
#1: He must be found, and exterminated.
Almost certainly he will try to gain access to his ship... his
TARDIS. — That must not be allowed to happen, Raspak.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL)
Page 67
(TERRIFIED) I will ensure that it is guarded at all times.
will not fail you, your holiness.
Go, Raspak. Obey your orders. Find the Doctor.
2 x DALEKS: Seek. Locate. Exterminate.
At once, brother Daleks!
LEAVES, THE DOOR SHUTTING BEHIND HIM.
I
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 68
35: INT. DALEKS’ CHAMBER
DALEK HEARTBEAT THROBS AWAY IN BACKGROUND AS BOSWYCK
DOCTOR, CONSTANCE, PENDLE AND ASTA IN.
Here, Doctor. Here is where the creatures have made their lair.
What a load of old rubbish.
(ADMONISHING) Master Boswyck’s trying to help us, Doctor.
Eh? (REALISATION) Not figuratively, literally! I meant all junk-!
METAL FRAGMENTS. CLATTERING.
Scrap retrieved from the crash site, I presume.
Their vessel must have hit the ground at quite a speed, if was all that could be recovered.
Many of the creatures died.
Lucky for you that they did.
(SNIFFING THE AIR) It stinks...!
Something’s not right, that’s for sure.
I meant literally, not figuratively. Ugh!
Doctor, look.
PICKS UP SOME METAL FRAGMENTS.
Were these Dalek casings, do you think?
this
this
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 69
Smashed to pieces. Not easy to smelt, Dalekanium. No wonder they needed new ones made.
(JUST OFF) Like these, for instance-?
(GOING OVER) Like those, Mrs Clarke! Only halfway finished, but I can’t fault the craftsmanship. Magnificent!
So the Dalek creatures sit inside these casings?
Yes.
But how do they control them? Where’s the machinery?

The Daleks have a certain psychokinetic ability, used in tandem with their technology. (THOUGHTFUL) But in the absence of that technology, they must be entirely reliant on that ability. Their mental powers must be rather more developed than I thought...
(OFF) Doctor, look at this.
What’s that you’ve found, Asta? (SEEING IT) Ah! The Daleks’ transmitter!
That’s what I thought.
The device that brought us here. Smash it, Asta! Switch it off!
No, no, you mustn’t!
But it’s dangerous! A siren signal, you said, drawing unwary travellers onto the rocks?
Yes yes yes. But if I’m not mistake, they’ve cannibalised parts of their saucer’s black box recorder to build it.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 70
So?
So...
BEEPS AND CLICKS AS THE DOCTOR TINKERS WITH THE CONTROLS.
If I can just access the recorder’s memory, I should be able to see exactly what brought the Daleks to this sector in the first place...
‘SCROLLING’ SOUND CONTINUES UNDER:

Got it! Yes. This was a Dalek assault team. Part of a battle fleet involved in the invasion of the planet Kantra. But their Saucer sustained some damage. It was on its way back to Skaro when its main drive unit gave out.
Hence the crash.
Hence the crash... Good heavens!
What is it, Doctor?

No wonder these Daleks have such highly developed mental abilities. They were an elite squad — part of the Emperor's personal guard, no less. (BEAT) Now that’s odd. There were a dozen Daleks aboard the saucer when it crashed. Most of them died on impact, but the Black Dalek — the saucer commander — survived, along with four others.
Hang on, we only know of four. The two that are already mobile, and the two destined for these new casings.
Exactly. So what’s happened to the fifth? What’s happened to the Black Dalek?
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 71
36: INT. ABBOT’S CHAMBER
#1: Whilst the Doctor is at liberty our plans are in danger.
#2: Dalek slaves must gain access to humans’ ship.
#1: Reacquisition of energy weapons must become our first priority.
No. Boosting the range of our transmitter must remain the first priority. Raspak and his guards are more than capable of handling the Doctor and his friends, without the use of energy weapons.
#2: Their weaponry is primitive and inefficient.
Against a superior force, I would agree. But the Doctor is not a superior force. He is a pacifist. A weakness that will prove his undoing!
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 72
37: INT. DALEKS’ CHAMBER
HEARTBEAT IN BACKGROUND. DOOR OPENS, OFF.
Doctor, the door!
Guards! Oh, mercy!
SHUFFLING FROM OFF AS 4 x NOVICES APPROACH.
There is no need for alarm. It is the novices whose duty it is to build these casings.
It’s like they’ve not seen us. What’s wrong with them?
Their every waking thought is focused upon the task in hand.
Conditioned, more like it. Or drugged. Still, perhaps if we just leave them be...
One of them might yet raise the alarm.
No. Each of those chosen to undertake this secret work has taken a vow of silence.
It’s not just a vow of silence that keeps them mute, though. Look at their throats.
They look like surgical scars.
Surgery? Why?
The Daleks need casings to move about in... but in order for them to speak...
These poor wretches have donated their larynxes, not just their blood.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 73
That’s horrible.
Isn’t it, just. The Abbot, he’s the key to all this. If I can persuade him to help us, he can help unite the entire brotherhood against the Daleks.
(INCREDULOUS) But he was the one who sent you to have your throat cut, remember!
The Abbot Tanapal I once knew would never have sanctioned such barbarism.
Exactly! I believe that the Daleks are influencing the Abbot is some way.
Nonsense. He’s just collaborating!
No, I don’t think so. The last time I was in his presence, I had the sense that he trying to tell me something. That strange pressure in my mind...
You and your ‘mental twinges’!
Yes. I’m guessing that the Abbot has been subjected to Dalek conditioning — just like these poor mutes! But if I were to help break that conditioning, our situation might be very different.
Doctor, am I correct in my assessment that you wish to speak to the Abbot alone?
You are, yes.
So it would help if Raspak’s guards were out of the way?
It would.
Then we must create some distraction.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 74
‘We’, Asta? ‘We’?!
You, me, Mrs Clarke and Master Boswyck — if that’s alright?
I’m game if you are.
I, too, am ‘game’.
Good. We’1ll draw the guards away, and meet you back at Master Boswyck’s quarters. Would that be agreeable, Doctor?
Most agreeable.
But—
Then we’re all agreed — aren’t we, Assessor?
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 75
38: INT. ABBOT’S CHAMBER
FADE UP. TINKLING OF WINDCHIMES AS BEFORE. RASPAK STRIDES IN.
Raspak. Has any progress been made with the strangers’ ship?
No, my lord. The blacksmith has managed to remove several panels from the hull, but so far access to the interior of the vessel eludes him.
BELL BEGINS CLANGING QUICKLY. WELL OFF.
He must try harder! We must gain access to that ship. — Are you listening, Raspak?
The chapel bell, your holiness! That’s no call to prayers! My guards must have caught up with the strangers!
Then go after them, Raspak!
At once, your holiness.
HURRIES AWAY. DOOR SLAMS. BEAT. DOOR OPENS AGAIN. DOCTOR ENTERS THE ROOM.
There you are, Abbot. A word, if I may...?
Doctor. I see now. Your friends have distracted my guards.
Is it so very obvious? A crude ploy, but nonetheless effective— (BREAKS OFF) ‘Doctor’?
STOPS.
You were foolish to return here.

I don’t think so. You see, every time we’ve met, I’ve sensed that there’s something you’ve been trying to tell me. (COMING CLOSER) Well, when I say ‘you’, I mean the real Abbot Tanapal, not the Daleks’ stooge.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 76
Keep away!
I’m right, aren’t I? — The mind of the true Abbot is locked up
somewhere in that shaven head, trying to get out. Fortunately,
I’m here to help him. (URGENT) Fight it, Tanapal. Fight against the Dalek conditioning!
/BLACK DALEK: (IE, POSSESSED TANAPAL — HIS VOICE BECOME MUCH MORE DALEK-LIKE, BUT UNMODULATED) You are mistaken, Doctor!

Oh, I don’t know. By the sounds of it the Dalek pushing the Abbot’s buttons is having to fight to retain control. Where are hiding, hm? Behind the drapes? Is that it? Literally, the power behind the Abbot’s throne?
/BLACK DALEK: Keep away from the curtain!
This chamber’s furnished so simply, you can’t be anywhere else.
PHYSICALLY TEARS BACK DRAPES — RIPPING FABRIC.
And there you are. The Black Dalek. Now let go of your puppet!
/BLACK DALEK: We will exterminate you, Doctor!
Without energy weapons? I don’t think so. So do as I ask, and relinquish control of the Abbot!
/BLACK DALEK: You misunderstand, Doctor. The Abbot has not been subject to Dalek conditioning.
What do you mean?
/BLACK DALEK: We have achieved communion inside the Abbot’s psyche. Our minds are working in symbiosis!
(HORRIFIED) No, that’s not possible.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 77
/BLACK DALEK:
Soon, we will invade the minds of every being in this galaxy and beyond. The word of the Daleks will be spread across the universe...!
END OF PART TWO
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 78
