PENDLE: ‘We’, Asta? ‘We’?!
ASTA: You, me, Mrs Clarke and Master Boswyck — if that’s alright?
CONSTANCE: I’m game if you are.
BOSWYCK: I, too, am ‘game’.
ASTA: Good. We’1ll draw the guards away, and meet you back at Master Boswyck’s quarters. Would that be agreeable, Doctor?
DOCTOR: Most agreeable.
PENDLE: But—
ASTA: Then we’re all agreed — aren’t we, Assessor?
ASTA: ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 75
ASTA: FADE UP. TINKLING OF WINDCHIMES AS BEFORE. RASPAK STRIDES IN.
TANAPAL: Raspak. Has any progress been made with the strangers’ ship?
RASPAK: No, my lord. The blacksmith has managed to remove several panels from the hull, but so far access to the interior of the vessel eludes him.
SUDDENLY: BELL BEGINS CLANGING QUICKLY. WELL OFF.
TANAPAL: He must try harder! We must gain access to that ship. — Are you listening, Raspak?
RASPAK: The chapel bell, your holiness! That’s no call to prayers! My guards must have caught up with the strangers!
TANAPAL: Then go after them, Raspak!
RASPAK: At once, your holiness.
RASPAK: HURRIES AWAY. DOOR SLAMS. BEAT. DOOR OPENS AGAIN. DOCTOR ENTERS THE ROOM.
DOCTOR: There you are, Abbot. A word, if I may...?
TANAPAL: Doctor. I see now. Your friends have distracted my guards.
DOCTOR: Is it so very obvious? A crude ploy, but nonetheless effective— (BREAKS OFF) ‘Doctor’?
BELL: STOPS.
TANAPAL: You were foolish to return here.
DOCTOR: I don’t think so. You see, every time we’ve met, I’ve sensed that there’s something you’ve been trying to tell me. (COMING CLOSER) Well, when I say ‘you’, I mean the real Abbot Tanapal, not the Daleks’ stooge.
DOCTOR: ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 76
TANAPAL: Keep away!
DOCTOR: I’m right, aren’t I? — The mind of the true Abbot is locked up
DOCTOR: somewhere in that shaven head, trying to get out. Fortunately,
DOCTOR: I’m here to help him. (URGENT) Fight it, Tanapal. Fight against the Dalek conditioning!
TANAPAL: /BLACK DALEK: (IE, POSSESSED TANAPAL — HIS VOICE BECOME MUCH MORE DALEK-LIKE, BUT UNMODULATED) You are mistaken, Doctor!
DOCTOR: Oh, I don’t know. By the sounds of it the Dalek pushing the Abbot’s buttons is having to fight to retain control. Where are hiding, hm? Behind the drapes? Is that it? Literally, the power behind the Abbot’s throne?
TANAPAL: /BLACK DALEK: Keep away from the curtain!
DOCTOR: This chamber’s furnished so simply, you can’t be anywhere else.
DOCTOR: PHYSICALLY TEARS BACK DRAPES — RIPPING FABRIC.
DOCTOR: And there you are. The Black Dalek. Now let go of your puppet!
TANAPAL: /BLACK DALEK: We will exterminate you, Doctor!
DOCTOR: Without energy weapons? I don’t think so. So do as I ask, and relinquish control of the Abbot!
TANAPAL: /BLACK DALEK: You misunderstand, Doctor. The Abbot has not been subject to Dalek conditioning.
DOCTOR: What do you mean?
TANAPAL: /BLACK DALEK: We have achieved communion inside the Abbot’s psyche. Our minds are working in symbiosis!
DOCTOR: (HORRIFIED) No, that’s not possible.
DOCTOR: ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 77
TANAPAL: /BLACK DALEK:
TANAPAL: Soon, we will invade the minds of every being in this galaxy and beyond. The word of the Daleks will be spread across the universe...!
TANAPAL: END OF PART TWO
TANAPAL: ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 78

elements.text: PART THREE
/BLACK DALEK: We have achieved communion inside the Abbot’s psyche. Our minds are working in symbiosis!
(HORRIFIED) No, that’s not possible.
/BLACK DALEK:
Soon, we will invade the minds of every being in this galaxy and beyond. The word of the Daleks will be spread across the universe... !
39: INT. ABBOT’S CHAMBER [CONTINUED]
Daleks projecting their consciousness directly into the minds of others?! How?!
/BLACK DALEK: It is the means by which the Daleks will become all-powerful.
How are you able to do this?! I demand to know!
/BLACK DALEK: (ASIDE) Daleks!!! Enter!!!
(AS BEFORE) AS PASSAGEWAY OPENS OFF. 2 x DALEKS EXIT.
#1: Do not move!
#2: You are our prisoner!
(TO TANAPAL) What are they going to do? Prod me to death?
/BLACK DALEK: Their weaponry is primitive, but nonetheless effective at close quarters.
(BACKING AWAY) I’1ll take that as a ‘yes’, then...
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 79
/BLACK DALEK: You will be returned to the chapel. Two Dalek survivors require nutrients still.
I’d rather not, if it’s all the same. Always happy to donate, but it seems you want rather more than an armful.
2 x DALEKS: Obey!!! Obey!!!
Alright, alright! — It looks awfully dark down that secret passage of yours. Perhaps we should take an oil lamp to light the way? (INSINCERE) Oh look, there’s one here. How very convenient.
HE LIFTS AN OIL LAMP FROM ITS STAND.
/BLACK DALEK: Doctor, replace that lantern!
My old tutor at the Academy once reminded me that a heavy, easily fusible, soft, malleable base metal such as lead is not the best defence against heat intensive weaponry.
/BLACK DALEK: (PUZZLED) What... weaponry?
This lamp, of course. I daresay it’s hot enough to cause some damage to your lovely new casings. Let’s find out, shall we?
EFFORT AS HE THROWS LAMP
CRASH OF GLASS AS LAMP SHATTERS ON THE FLOOR IN FRONT OF THE DALEKS, SENDING BURNING OIL SPLASHING EVERYWHERE.
#1: Danger! Danger! Integrity of casing may be compromised!
#2: Temperature exceeds primitive engineering tolerances! Retreat! Retreat!
Primitive — but nonetheless effective at close quarters.
/BLACK DALEK: (CALLING) Guards! Assist us!
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL)
So sorry that I can’t stay and help. Things to do...
INTO THE SECRET PASSAGEWAY )
/BLACK DALEK: Raspak! You are needed! Assist me! Assist!
CRACKLE OF FLAMES CONTINUES.
Page 80
(EXITS BACK
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 81
40: INT. BOSWYCK’S QUARTERS
The Doctor’s failed, that much is obvious. Now we’re no better off than we were before — hiding out in this Boswyck’s apothecary!
Senior Assessor. Please shut up.
What did you say?!
What all three of us were thinking. Master Boswyck — the black flowers on the windowsill: are they what gave your Brotherhood their name?
(CURTLY) Yes, but they’re of no interest.
They’re beautiful. Like an orchid, but the petals are iridescent, almost metallic. And as for their scent —
(SNAPPING) I said, they’re of no interest!
(TAKEN ABACK) I’m sorry.
I... picked them for the purpose of preparing a potion, that’s all.
PAIRS OF RUNNING FEET BEHIND DOOR, IN CORRIDOR.
(RUNNING, IN CORRIDOR) Quickly. Bring water! The Abbot’s
chamber is ablaze! Hurry, before the flames take hold!
(ALARMED) A fire! Do you smell smoke...?
(SIGHS) I smell trouble.
The Doctor?
Who else?!
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 82
AN URGENT KNOCKING ON THE GLASS OF THE WINDOW.
Speak of the devil.
(THROUGH GLASS) Won’t somebody let me in?!
The Doctor? What’s he doing outside the window?!
Goodness knows. Shall we do as he asks?
Allow me. —
OPENS LEAD/GLASS WINDOW (SIMPLE HINGE).
Thank you, Master Boswyck. (CLIMBING IN) I must apologise for the most unorthodox entrance. I got lost in the passageways, and the only way out I could find [led me]
Never mind all that. Are we to presume that you didn’t manage to get the Abbot on our side?
I didn’t, no.
(SNORTS) Huh!
I did, however, learn something of vital importance. Things are far, far worse than I realised.
Worse?
The Black Dalek has found some way to put its mind inside that of the Abbot. They’re sharing some strange symbiosis.
(SCOFFS) ‘Symbiosis’!
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 83
Please, Mr Pendle. It’s not necessary to heckle.
How are they doing this, Doctor?
That I didn’t discover. But if I don’t find out — the consequences could be disastrous. Not just for this planet, but the entire civilised cosmos!
(TENTATIVELY) I... may be able to help answer that question.
Really, Master Boswyck?
Not here. The answer, I believe, lies outside these walls.
Well — we may never have a better chance to escape the monastery than now, while the guards are distracted.
Come, then, all of you. We must hurry.
We can’t just leave! What about the shuttle?
Asta’s right, if the Daleks gain access to the shuttle’s transmitter, they can bring in reinforcements.
Well, then, the answer’s simple. If we want to stop the Daleks getting hold of the transmitter, all we have to do is get inside the ship and remove it without their noticing.
‘AL?
Constance is right. It’s getting dark, we can sneak in through
the emergency hatch and be gone without anyone knowing.
I’m willing to give it a try.
OPENS DOOR.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 84
Doctor, if we are to leave without being seen then we need to do so now.
Well, all right. But promise me you’1ll be careful, Mrs Clarke.
I wasn’t actually waiting for your say-so.
No, I don’t suppose you were. Come on then, Pendle.
Can’t I stay here?
Asta and Constance are going to require stealth and speed if
they’re to remain undetected, and neither you nor I are built for either. You’ll be far better off with me. Now hurry, man!
DOCTOR, PENDLE AND BOSWYCK HURRY OFF.
Right then, Asta. Hoods up. Let’s hide amongst the novices.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 85
41. EXT. REAR OF MONASTERY
FADE UP. 2 x SLEEM — IE, CAMEL-LIKE PACK ANIMALS — LED UP BY ROSCO AND GABBER.
Here’s the beasts, Master Boswyck.
ONE OF THEM BRAYS SLIGHTLY.
Hush there, you.
Thank you, Rosco and Gabber. (PATS RUMP OF A SLEEM) Yes, these Sleem will do nicely.
Ah, so these are Sleem!
We use them as beasts of burden, but they can be fleet of foot when the need arises.
You surely don’t expect me to ride one of these things?
We shall need them to carry supplies.
I asked Allget the Unready for planna bread. I told him it was for the prisoners’ last meal.
Very enterprising of you, Rosco.
I’m not sure he believed me, though, Master Boswyck. He said he’d check with Raspak.
Then I suppose you two boys must come with us.
Am I to take it we have a long journey ahead?
We do. Come on.
SET OFF INTO THE NIGHT, WITH SLEEM.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 86
42: EXT. COURTYARD
FADE UP. 2 x BROTHERS HAMMERING HULL OF SHUTTLE, OFF.
(SOTTO) The brothers haven’t given up on the shuttle, then.
(SOTTO) Yes, they’ve managed to get a section of the heat shielding off. That’s given them access to the hull below.
(SOTTO) Surely they won’t be able to get through that, though? If it’s strong enough to withstand travelling through space...
(SOTTO) Space travel is about dealing with extremes of hot and cold, and the occasional micrometeorite. It’s not about being attacked with pickaxes and hammers!
(SOTTO) Can you see this ‘emergency hatch’?
(SOTTO) Yes. But it’s in full view of the main gates. And there are guards. (SIGHS) What was I thinking, trying this?
(SOTTO) It’s nearly dark. They’re monks — perhaps they’1l break for evensong, or vespers, or something.
(SOTTO) Perhaps.
(SOTTO) We’re just going to have to wait for our moment.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 87
43: EXT. MOORLAND
FADE UP. DOCTOR, PENDLE AND BOSWYCK FOLLOW ROSCO AND GABBER,
SOFTLY BRAYING SLEEM.
(WHEEZING WITH EFFORT) Please, I have to stop.
We should be far enough from the monastery by now. We’1ll rest here for a while before going on.
Thank goodness. (HE SLUMPS ONTO THE GROUND)
ROSCO AND GABBER STAY SLEEM.
Perhaps now you might tell us exactly where we’re going, Master Boswyck.

You wanted to know how the Black Dalek might have managed to imprint its thoughts inside the Abbot’s mind? I believe it has something to do with a secret our Brotherhood has guarded for centuries. A secret that lies in the mountains, that until recently was known only to a few of us...
(APPALLED) Master, surely you wouldn’t...
I have no choice, young Rosco.
(GETTING ANGRIER) But you cannot! You have taken a vow. These people are not holy!
These people are our only hope.
I thought that you meant only to help these people escape the monastery. But if you take them to the secret place, then you will have abandoned your sacred trust!
Rosco, please...
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 88
No! — Gabber, come on. We’re leaving. (BEAT) I mean it. We cannot be part of this. (BEAT) I have listened enough. (BEAT) Well, then — you be damned with them. I’1l1 have no part in this!
HE MOUNTS ONE OF THE SLEEM. IT BRAYS.
Leave if you must, boy. But please, do not take one of our
Sleem.
I shall not take one, Boswyck — no! (TO SLEEM) Ya! Ya!!!
SLEEM BRAY, THEN GALLOP OFF INTO THE DARKNESS.
Rosco, come back. Rosco!
THERE IS NOTHING.
Without those creatures, we have no supplies! We’1ll never make
it!
That, I believe, was young Rosco’s intent.
We may yet prevail by foraging. But it will be hard.
A DISTANT WOLF-LIKE HOWL, JOINED BY ANOTHER, THEN ANOTHER.
(TERRIFIED) W-what was that?
It sounds like a pack of Vulteen.
Vulteen? What are Vulteen?
I think we’d better get moving again before we find out.
It’s another hour to the foot of the mountains.
An hour!!!
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 89
Gabber. Fetch wood. Build a fire. With luck, that will keep the
Vulteen at bay...
CONTINUE TO HOWL. CROSS TO:
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 90
44: EXT. COURTYARD
VULTEEN HOWLS ECHO FROM THE DISTANT MOORLAND. HAMMERING
AS BEFORE, OFF.
NB: SOTTO VOICES THROUGHOUT.
What was that?
Sounded like wolves on the moors. I daresay the Doctor will be
alright.
I was more worried about Assessor Pendle.
TOLLING OF CHAPEL BELL, OFF.
The chapel bell!
DOWN TOOLS AND BEGIN TO EXIT COURTYARD.
I was right. The brothers are leaving. Heading for the chapel.
Then this is our chance! Come on, while their backs are turned.
FOOTSTEPS AS THEY SCRAMBLE FROM THEIR HIDING PLACE AND HEAD FOR THE SHUTTLE. CROSS PERSPECTIVE TO BESIDE THE SHUTTLE. THEY RUN UP.
(SLIGHTLY BREATHLESS) Made it. Still, I’m surprised they’ve left the shuttle unguarded.
(ALARM) They haven't!
2 x DALEKS ENTER THE COURTYARD, OFF.
Daleks! Quick, get behind the wing!
CROSS TO BESIDE DALEKS, MOVING UP TO SHUTTLE.
#1: Human slaves have not yet penetrated the hull.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 91
#2: Daleks cannot increase slaves’ efficiency by means of sample extermination. We must achieve our objective otherwise.
#1: What is your strategy?
#2: If Dalek slaves cannot enter the vessel, a Dalek must do so instead.
#1: How? Improvised Dalek weaponry is not fit for purpose.
#2: There is a way. But we shall require humanoid assistance.
2 x DALEKS GLIDE AWAY.
What was that about?
I’m not sure. But I get the impression that our time might be running out...
The hatchway’s just here. Best we get on with it. — Computer, prepare to accept entry code.
AS A PANEL OPENS. ‘BIPS’ AND ‘BLEEPS’ AS ASTA ACCESSES THE
PROGRAMME.
Code, Probationary Assessor Asta. Secondary authorisation: seven, seven, oblique, nine. Confirm.
SERIES OF BLEEPS.
Is that it?
Not yet. — Prepare to accept retina scan.
SERIES OF BLEEPS. SOFT HISS AS HATCH OPENS UP.
That’s it! — Inside, quickly!
ASTA AND CONSTANCE HURRY THROUGH THE HATCH, INTO...
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 92
45: INT. SHUTTLECRAFT [CONTINUOUS ]
Secure hatchway.
BLEEP; HISS AS HATCH CLOSES.
(WITH RELIEF) We’re safe...
I can’t see a thing.
I daren’t activate the internal lights, the Daleks outside will notice. Follow me, we’ll feel our way to the cockpit.
Can’t we contact your superiors? Get help?
Only from orbit. But if we were to try to launch the shuttle from the confines of this courtyard, the backblast might damage or destroy it.
Safer we just stick to the plan to disable the transmitter.
I think so. (ARRIVING IN COCKPIT) Here we are. — Computer. Allow access to communications console.
BLEEP; HISS AS CONSOLE OPENS.
It looks complicated.
It’s just the transmitter circuits we need to disable. — Computer, disconnect power to console circuits.
BLEEP.
Right. There’s the circuit we need to remove. Constance, there
should be a tool kit in the locker beside your [head. ]
A CLAWS-ON-METAL SCRABBLING ALL AROUND THEM. DISTANT
SQUEAL (A DALEK MUTANT HAS GOT IN).
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 93
Did you heard that?
It came from the engine section. Constance, something’s trying to get in through the exhaust!
(SLOWLY) “If Dalek slaves cannot enter the vessel, a Dalek must do so instead.”
A Dalek couldn’t fit through the exhaust, any more than a
human!
No. But one of the creatures inside the Dalek casing might.
SCRABBLING. MORE SQUEALING.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 94
46: EXT. MOORLAND
FIRE.
I think the fire’s scared those Vulteen off.
I hope so.
Master Boswyck — since we have a few moments to talk, perhaps you can tell me how the Daleks went from being crash survivors in need of help, to controlling the entire brotherhood?

Most of it I have told you already. We did our best to heal their wounds, and began to construct the casings they told us they needed to survive. The Daleks promised Tanapal they would show him how to broadcast our creed across the heavens, by rebuilding their ‘transmitter’. He succumbed first to their temptation, and then to their will.
But surely the others must have noticed?
The Abbot is infallible, that is how our Order has always worked.
But how did they do it? Take over the Abbot’s every thought?
Our order has always enjoyed a special relationship with the world, Doctor, a communion with nature. Take young Gabber. Mute, and yet his brother seems to understand his every thought...
A common enough trait in twin siblings.
Ah, but it’s more than just [that...]
HOWLS. ANOTHER ANSWERS. AND ANOTHER. AND ANOTHER. FROM
AROUND.
Vulteen! They’re all around us! I thought they’d gone...!
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 95
Listen. I don’t think they’re trying to scare us. I think they’re communicating with one other...!
They are not without intelligence.
Well, what are they saying?
At a guess: ‘spread out, make a circle, then draw in for the kill’?
We must arm ourselves! Gabber — make torches!
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 96
47: INT. SHUTTLECRAFT
SCRABBLING. MORE SQUEALING. LOUDER.
That thing’s behind the interior bulkheads now. We’ve got to get out of here!
The transmitter, Asta. We have to finish the job!
Yes, yes, of course. (EFFORT — TRYING TO PULL OUT WITH CIRCUIT BOARD) It’s useless, the circuit’s stuck!
(FEELING AROUND) Hold on. I can feel it. — Yes, there’s one connection still attached. Where’s that screwdriver gone...?
Here! (PASSES SCREWDRIVER)
(EFFORT) I should be able to lever it out...
A CLICK AS THE CIRCUIT COMES FREE.
That’s it! It’s free! — Right, let’s get out of here before...
MUTANT SQUEALS UP CLOSE.
(SOTTO) Before that thing makes it past the bulkhead, were you about to say?
(SOTTO) Yes...!
(SOTTO) I think it already has. (LOUD) Asta, run!!!
THEY SCRAMBLE DOWN THE LENGTH OF THE SHUTTLE, THE MUTANT SCRABBLING AND SQUEALING BEHIND THEM.
(CALLING OUT) Computer, prepare to accept exit code!!!
We don’t have time for all that palaver! What if there’s a fire in here, what do you do?!
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 97
There’s an emergency release switch.
Where?!
Somewhere beside the hatch. To your right!
TERRIFYING SCRABBLING. STOPS.
(FEELING AROUND) I’ve got it, I think. Like a handle?
No, just a switch.
Then what am I holding...?
EXPLOSION OF SOUND — THE MUTANT ATTACKS CONSTANCE.
FRANTICALLY.
Constance!
(FIGHTING MUTANT) Get that hatch open!!! Hurry!!!
(FEELING AROUND) I’m trying!
(TO MUTANT) Stupid thing, you should have known better than attack a woman with a screwdriver in her free hand...!
MUTANT WITH SCREWDRIVER. IT SQUEALS IN PAIN, SCUTTLES AWAY. HATCH HISSES OPEN.
Got it! Come on, Constance...!
ASTA AND CONSTANCE TUMBLE OUT OF THE HATCH, INTO:
to
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 98
48: EXT. COURTYARD [CONTINUOUS]
Well, well. The two ‘apprentice boys’.
Oh no.
You!
Put that tool down. We have you surrounded.
#1: Move away from the craft! Surrender the transmitter component!
There’s no way out. Do as the Dalek says, Asta.
SQUEAL OF MUTANT AT HATCH.
Your brother is wounded, Master.
#1: Dalek mutant requires further nutrients. Humanoids will surrender nutrients.
Oh no...!
Brothers! Take them to the chapel!
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 99
49: EXT. MOORLAND
YOWLING, SNARLING VULTEEN SURROUND THE DOCTOR, PENDLE, BOSWYCK AND GABBER. ALL WITH BURNING TORCHES, TRYING TO WAVE THE
OFF.
There’s so many of them! It’s hopeless!
Don’t give up, Pendle! Use your torch! Drive them back! Like so! (JABS TORCH)
A VULTEEN WHICKERS AS IT RETREATS, BURNED.
There, do you see?!
(OFF — CRIES OUT, BITTEN) Aaaah!
They’ve got Boswyck!
Gabber, help me!!! (RUSHING TO BOSWYCK) Get back, you curs! Hai! Hai!
“WHOOSH’ OF TORCHES; SNARLS OF VULTEEN...
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 100
50: INT. ABBOT’S CHAMBERS
#1: Shuttlecraft has now been accessed. Power has been restored.
/BLACK DALEK:
Excellent. Go now, supervise removal of all necessary components. We must — (GASPS; SUDDEN WINCE OF MENTAL PAIN) — must...
#1: Continue instructions. Continue!
(IE, IN CASING BEHIND THRONE. WEAKENED, SLOW) Symbiotic link with humanoid cult leader has been broken.
I.. do not know. I am... weak. I need... nutrients. Fetch nutrients!
#1: I obey.
MOVES OFF.
(TO SELF — FREE OF DALEK INFLUENCE) The balance is disturbed. Then there is a chance!
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 101
51: INT. CHAPEL
CONSTANCE AND ASTA ARE DRAGGED THROUGH CHAPEL DOORS.
I’m sorry, Asta. This is all my fault.
Hardly!
Travelling with the Doctor has begun to make me feel invincible. I suggested retrieving that transmitter without proper consideration of the danger. I wish I’d not been quite so blasé.
One can’t coolly assess everything, Constance. I’ve learned that much today.
Quiet! Kneel before the altar. — Kneel! (ASIDE) Habrild: the needle...!
Yes, Raspak.
Now the chalice. The Daleks require... (VOICE STARTS TO TAIL OFF AND SLUR) .. require that these... these two women...
(SLURRING) Raspak? What’s... wrong?
I.. I don’t... know...
What’s happening?
I don’t know! It’s like they all just... fainted!
Why? Some kind of gas?
If that were the case, then we’d be affected.
Whatever it is, let’s get out of here while we can!
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 102
52: EXT. MOORLAND
RETREATING HOWLS OF VULTEEN.
Thank goodness. The Vulteen are retreating. We’ve driven them off!
It’s nearly sun-up. Doubtless these Vulteen are nocturnal — is that right, Boswyck?
(WEAK) Yes... Doctor. They’1ll have gone in search of easier meat, I.. (REELS, SLOWS) .. I suppose...
Boswyck? Boswyck, are you alright?
That bite they gave him. Perhaps it was poisonous?
How should I know?
Well, you are a Doctor!
Not of medicine. So far as I can tell his wounds are superficial, but...
(GROANING WITH EFFORT) Not... poison. I am.. unconnected to this world. And so... I am weakened.
Weakened? I don’t understand.
I must show you. Before it’s too late.
Surely we can’t go on with him in this state?
I don’t see that we’ve got any choice. — Come on, Gabber, help me get him to his feet.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 103
(HELPED TO FEET) We must follow a secret trail through the mountains. Gabber, my boy, it’s all up to you now. Lead us there.
SET OFF. FADE.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 104
53: INT. BOSWYCK’S APOTHECARY
OPENED FROM OUTSIDE. CONSTANCE AND ASTA RUSH IN.
What are we doing back in Boswyck’s apothecary?
Boswyck had keys to the secret passageways, and we need more places to run to. You search his desk, I’1l search the cabinets.
All right.
AS CONSTANCE OPENS CABINETS, ASTA TRIES DRAWERS ON HIS DESK.
Drawers are locked.
(SEARCHING) Well, try and prise them open.
He'd have needed his keys to lock them, wouldn’t he?
UNFURLS PARCHMENT ON DESK.
Constance, come here.
(SEARCHING) I’m busy.
There’s an illustrated manuscript here. It seems to be — I don’t know, a recipe perhaps? Something to do with that black flower Boswyck was so protective of.
(COMING OVER) Really?
The ‘dream flower’, it says. ‘By which means the mind and the world may be linked, in symbiosis...’
Symbiosis...?
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 105
54: INT. VALLEY
GABBER, DOCTOR, BOSWYCK AND PENDLE REACH THE TOP OF A RISE.
Why’s the boy stopped?
Our destination is just over this rise.
One last heave, Mr Pendle.

DALEK: MOVES OFF.
TANAPAL: (TO SELF — FREE OF DALEK INFLUENCE) The balance is disturbed. Then there is a chance!
TANAPAL: ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 101
TANAPAL: CONSTANCE AND ASTA ARE DRAGGED THROUGH CHAPEL DOORS.
CONSTANCE: I’m sorry, Asta. This is all my fault.
ASTA: Hardly!
CONSTANCE: Travelling with the Doctor has begun to make me feel invincible. I suggested retrieving that transmitter without proper consideration of the danger. I wish I’d not been quite so blasé.
ASTA: One can’t coolly assess everything, Constance. I’ve learned that much today.
RASPAK: Quiet! Kneel before the altar. — Kneel! (ASIDE) Habrild: the needle...!
HABRILD: Yes, Raspak.
RASPAK: Now the chalice. The Daleks require... (VOICE STARTS TO TAIL OFF AND SLUR) .. require that these... these two women...
HABRILD: (SLURRING) Raspak? What’s... wrong?
RASPAK: I.. I don’t... know...
ASTA: What’s happening?
CONSTANCE: I don’t know! It’s like they all just... fainted!
ASTA: Why? Some kind of gas?
CONSTANCE: If that were the case, then we’d be affected.
ASTA: Whatever it is, let’s get out of here while we can!
ASTA: ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 102
DISTANT: RETREATING HOWLS OF VULTEEN.
PENDLE: Thank goodness. The Vulteen are retreating. We’ve driven them off!
DOCTOR: It’s nearly sun-up. Doubtless these Vulteen are nocturnal — is that right, Boswyck?
BOSWYCK: (WEAK) Yes... Doctor. They’1ll have gone in search of easier meat, I.. (REELS, SLOWS) .. I suppose...
DOCTOR: Boswyck? Boswyck, are you alright?
PENDLE: That bite they gave him. Perhaps it was poisonous?
DOCTOR: How should I know?
PENDLE: Well, you are a Doctor!
DOCTOR: Not of medicine. So far as I can tell his wounds are superficial, but...
BOSWYCK: (GROANING WITH EFFORT) Not... poison. I am.. unconnected to this world. And so... I am weakened.
DOCTOR: Weakened? I don’t understand.
BOSWYCK: I must show you. Before it’s too late.
PENDLE: Surely we can’t go on with him in this state?
DOCTOR: I don’t see that we’ve got any choice. — Come on, Gabber, help me get him to his feet.
DOCTOR: ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 103
BOSWYCK: (HELPED TO FEET) We must follow a secret trail through the mountains. Gabber, my boy, it’s all up to you now. Lead us there.
ALL: SET OFF. FADE.
ALL: ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 104
DOOR: OPENED FROM OUTSIDE. CONSTANCE AND ASTA RUSH IN.
ASTA: What are we doing back in Boswyck’s apothecary?
CONSTANCE: Boswyck had keys to the secret passageways, and we need more places to run to. You search his desk, I’1l search the cabinets.
ASTA: All right.
ASTA: AS CONSTANCE OPENS CABINETS, ASTA TRIES DRAWERS ON HIS DESK.
ASTA: Drawers are locked.
CONSTANCE: (SEARCHING) Well, try and prise them open.
ASTA: He'd have needed his keys to lock them, wouldn’t he?
ASTA: UNFURLS PARCHMENT ON DESK.
ASTA: Constance, come here.
CONSTANCE: (SEARCHING) I’m busy.
ASTA: There’s an illustrated manuscript here. It seems to be — I don’t know, a recipe perhaps? Something to do with that black flower Boswyck was so protective of.
CONSTANCE: (COMING OVER) Really?
ASTA: The ‘dream flower’, it says. ‘By which means the mind and the world may be linked, in symbiosis...’
CONSTANCE: Symbiosis...?
CONSTANCE: ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 105
CONSTANCE: GABBER, DOCTOR, BOSWYCK AND PENDLE REACH THE TOP OF A RISE.
PENDLE: Why’s the boy stopped?
BOSWYCK: Our destination is just over this rise.
DOCTOR: One last heave, Mr Pendle.
PENDLE: (EFFORT; BEAT) Is this it? — There’s nothing here. It’s just a valley full of flowers!
DOCTOR: Black flowers. There was one of these plants in your apothecary, Boswyck...!
BOSWYCK: The answers that you seek are to be found in this valley, Doctor.
DOCTOR: (REALISATION) And I recognise them now. Ostrecallis Mediosai!
PENDLE: I beg your pardon?
DOCTOR: The Dream Flower, native to the planet Ostrecallis Major. I thought it went extinct when the entire Ostrecallis system was consumed by a meganova!
PENDLE: ‘Meganova’ ...?
DOCTOR: Don’t worry about it. — And yet somehow, these remarkable flowers have survived. Their seeds drifting though space, driven by solar winds, perhaps?
BOSWYCK: The flowers grow nowhere else, Doctor. They are unique to this valley. From their petals, we brothers long since learned to synthesise a liquid extract — ‘by which means the mind and the world may be linked, in symbiosis...’
PENDLE: ‘Symbiosis’!
PENDLE: ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 106
DOCTOR: You consume the extract of the dream flower?
BOSWYCK: So we may be as one with nature, and nature as one with us.
DOCTOR: That’s one way of putting it. Extract of the Dream Flower was notorious for its hallucinogenic effects. And you say you take it?
BOSWYCK: All the time. Have you never heard the grass grow, Doctor? Or a the ringing of the atoms inside a raindrop as it strikes the ground?
DOCTOR: No I have not. And I can’t say I care to.
BOSWYCK: Before the Daleks came, we lived in perfect harmony with nature. But now that balance has been altered.
DOCTOR: Altered how?
BOSWYCK: The Daleks used our lifeblood to grow stronger. But by absorbing our blood, their consciousness became part of the collective mind.
DOCTOR: Overpowered it, more like.
BOSWYCK: The Abbot himself was overwhelmed. Many of my brothers became cruel, and blindly obedient. When I realised what was happening, I withheld the extract from myself. Made myself an outcast from our collective mind. That is why I am weakened now.
PENDLE: But you could have told us all this at the monastery!
BOSWYCK: I did not bring you here for a guided tour. I brought you here to help me destroy the flowers.
PENDLE: Destroy them?! Why?
PENDLE: ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 107
DOCTOR: Oh, I doubt that analysis of that chemical is beyond the Daleks. They’1l soon realise its potential. Take the secret back to Skaro, and they could manufacture it by the gallon!
PENDLE: What?
DOCTOR: Mix it into clouds, and the Dalek mind might literally rain down on a target planet. Whole planetary populations could fall under Dalek influence, just by turning on a tap.
BOSWYCK: That is what I feared. So long as our way of life was a secret, we were safe. [But if the Daleks should be rescued by their own kind... ]
OVER THIS: THE SOUND OF A SHUTTLE APPROACHING.
PENDLE: Err... Doctor... Master Boswyck? — Look, in the sky.
DOCTOR: Mm? — Oh! (BRIGHTLY — HE THINKS IT MIGHT BE CONSTANCE) Ohh...!
PENDLE: That’s my shuttle!
PENDLE: UNDER-SHUTTLE RETROS FIRE.
DOCTOR: (OVER NOISE) Get back, everyone! It’s coming in to land...!
BOSWYCK: (OVER NOISE) You don’t seem very troubled, Doctor.
DOCTOR: (OVER NOISE) I’1l give you good odds that Asta and Mrs Clarke found a way to fly the shuttle out!
PENDLE: (OVER NOISE) You think?
DOCTOR: (OVER NOISE) I’ve learned to rely on Mrs Clarke! One of my most
DOCTOR: constant companions, Constance!
SHUTTLE: HAS LANDED. AS HATCH HISSES OPEN (AS EARLIER) :
SHUTTLE: ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 108
PENDLE: But in that case... how did they know to find us here?
DALEK: #1: (FROM HATCH) Doctor! You will surrender to the Daleks!
DOCTOR: (CALLING) Why should I?
PLASMA: BLAST STRIKES NEARBY.
DALEK: #1: (FROM HATCH) Daleks have acquired plasma weaponry from the human vessel. We have regained our capacity to exterminate!
PENDLE: Oh no!!!
DOCTOR: (CALLING) But I don’t understand — how did you find this place?
PENDLE: I think they were helped. — Beside the Dalek. Look!
ROSCO: (FROM HATCH) Master Boswyck. You must surrender!
BOSWYCK: (SHOCKED) Rosco. How could you betray us?
DOCTOR: Oh, I doubt he had any choice in the matter. With every passing hour the Daleks’ malign influence gets stronger. The more of the extract they ingest, directly or indirectly, the greater their powers become.
DALEK: #1: (FROM HATCH) The plants here will be harvested. Their extract will be synthesised.
DOCTOR: (GRIM) Once this planet was a Garden of Eden. Soon it’1l be nothing more than a Dalek chemical factory.
DALEK: #1: (FROM HATCH) Soon, the Order of the Daleks will reign supreme!
DALEK: END OF PART THREE
DALEK: ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 109

elements.text: PART FOUR
(FROM HATCH) The plants here will be harvested. Their extract will be synthesised.
(GRIM) Once this planet was a Garden of Eden. Soon it’ll be
nothing more than a Dalek chemical factory.
#1: (FROM HATCH) Soon, the Order of the Daleks will reign supreme!
55: EXT. VALLEY [CONTINUOUS]
You do not belong here, Dalek! We nurtured you, and in return you polluted our minds!
(FROM HATCH) You are Boswyck. You are an outsider. You do not belong in the Order of the Daleks...!
(REALISING WHAT’S GOING TO HAPPEN — SHOVES BOSWYCK ASIDE) No! Master Boswyck is a good man!
(SHOVED ASIDE) Gabber? Get back! What are you doing, boy?
#1: (FROM HATCH) Exterminate!!!
BLAST — STRIKES GABBER.
SCREAMS, DIES
FALLS TO GROUND. CROSS TO HATCH — IE, BESIDE DALEK/ROSCO.
Gabber...? (TO DALEK) You killed him! You killed Gabber!!!
#1: Wrong target exterminated. Recharging plasma weapon.
RECHARGING SOUND. CROSS BACK TO:
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 110
Doctor, we're sitting ducks here!
Plasma weaponry requires time to recharge between blasts. (CALLING) Rosco — now’s your chance. Disengage and deactivate
that weapon!
(FROM HATCH — UNFAMILIAR EXPRESSION) Dis...?
He doesn’t know what you mean.
Rip it out of its socket!
BACK TO DALEK/ROSCO.
That I understand! (GRAPPLES WITH DALEK)
#1: (GRAPPLED BY GABBER) Brother Rosco, do not lay hands on me...!
(EFFORT) You are not my brother! Gabber was my brother! (YANKS
PULLED FROM SOCKET.
(OFF) He’s got it!
#1: You will replace my weapon!
You killed Gabber! So I shall kill you..!
(OFF) Rosco — no! Not so close!
BLAST — UP CLOSE. DALEK EXPLODES.
SCREECHES, DIES
BOSWYCK, DOCTOR AND PENDLE RUSH UP TO SHUTTLE.
(ARRIVING BESIDE SHUTTLE) Rosco? (APPALLED) Novice Rosco...!
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 111
Stupid boy, he’s burned himself!
What was it I said about heckling, Pendle?! (CHECKING ROSCO OVER) He’s alive, at least. Rosco, can you hear me? Rosco?
(STERN) Novice Rosco — wake up, boy! Wake up, or I’1l have you mucking out the Sleem stable for a fortnight!!!
(SHUDDERING BREATH) Master Boswyck...?
Thank goodness.
We showed that Dalek, didn’t we, Master? Gabber and me.
The debt I owe your brave brother can never be repaid, Rosco.

Yes it can, but only if we hurry. The Daleks have the components they need to repair the transmitter now, that much is plain. So it’s only a matter of time before they make contact with Skaro, and summon a whole invasion fleet to Strellin.
Then the three of you must return to the monastery with all speed.
No, we can’t leave you here. That bite needs looking at, for one thing.
I’m a herbalist, I can attend to my own injury. No, you must go without me. I am weak without the strength of my brothers — but too weak to resist the Daleks’ influence, I fear.
But —
No, Rosco. I shall be safe here. Once the Daleks are destroyed, then you can return for me.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 112
(IMPATIENT) Very well. Into the shuttle, you two.
Surely you don’t presume to fly my shuttle..?!
Only to within a safe distance of the monastery. We’1l scuttle the shuttle in the moorland, and make the rest of the way on foot.
(OUTRAGED) Scuttle my shuttle!
Yes — that’s rather good, isn’t it? — Just get in, Pendle!
Doctor — take this phial with you. I have been carrying it around my neck, but I have not dared take it.
HE REMOVES THE PHIAL OF LIQUID FROM AROUND HIS NECK
Dream flower extract, I presume?
It may help you to exert a little influence of your own...
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 113
56: INT. SECRET PASSAGEWAY
FADE UP. CONSTANCE AND ASTA MAKE THEIR WAY ALONG THE PASSAGEWAY.
I hope you know where you’re going, Constance.
I’m trusting to my sense of direction, I admit. But I’m sure this passage will lead us to the Abbot’s room.
And you really think this plant extract we’ve brewed up will help restore the Abbot’s real personality?
The Doctor wanted to break the Daleks’ hold over the Abbot. But Boswyck’s parchments seem to suggest that these Dream Flowers maintain some kind of psychic balance here.
(SCEPTICAL) So all the Abbot needs is a taste of this stuff, and his true personality will be restored?
You’re sceptical.
Is it obvious?
Remember the Doctor’s mental twinges. What if the presence he sensed was the true Abbot, trying to make contact? If so — he might be the only person in the monastery who can help us.
And if we’re completely wrong about all this?
Then this is a very, very stupid idea. But you heard the shuttle take flight, just as I did. The situation’s desperate enough to justify an educated guess.
Admit it, we’re flailing around in the dark.
Not for much longer. I think this is the door to the Abbot’s room... !
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 114
57: INT. ABBOT’S CHAMBER [CONTINUOUS]
DOOR FROM SECRET PASSAGEWAY GRINDS OPEN (AS BEFORE). CONSTANCE AND ASTA CREEP IN.
(WHISPERING) Dark in here.
/BLACK DALEK: (ASIDE) There is a reason for that.
& ASTA: (STARTLED) Ahh!
/BLACK DALEK: We have learned that oil lamps are hazardous.
We came to speak to the Abbot. To Abbot Tanapal. Is he in there, at all?
/BLACK DALEK:
The Abbot... resists us still. My concentration wavers only when I have had insufficient nutrient. But now I am well-fed. It is futile!!!
Asta, uncork the phial.
/BLACK DALEK: Phial? The plant extract will not assist the Abbot. (EFFORT) The Abbot is mine to control.
Let’s find out, shall we?
PHIAL.
/BLACK DALEK: Guards! Guards...!
(GRABBING ABBOT) Resistance is futile.
/BLACK DALEK: Release me...!
I’1ll hold your nose if I have to. Asta, make him drink. (BEAT) Asta...?
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 115
(SNIFFS) I feel... strange.
Do it, Asta!!!
/BLACK DALEK: No. Inhale the perfume of the Dream Flowers.
The perfume. Yes.
Oh no...
/BLACK DALEK: She has ingested the chemical extract. She is part of the collective mind. She is subject to the will of the Daleks!
Your... will.
Asta, throw that phial away!
/BLACK DALEK: You know what to do, Asta.
You must inhale it too. You must join us.
I will not!
You will obey!!! (GRABS CONSTANCE)
Asta, what are you doing..? Let go, you’re hurting me!
(WRESTLING) Inhale the scent! Consume the extract! Obey!!!
(STRUGGLING) The Black Dalek’s trying to control your mind. Remember who you are, Asta! Remember what you came here to protect!
Obey!!!
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 116
You are Probationary Assessor Jane Asta. You are here to protect a grade three civilisation! Remember that? Remember the rules about grade three civilisations?
Grade... three?
What are the rules, Asta?
(HALTINGLY, BUT PICKING UP SPEED) “A grade three planet has no Significant technology, no knowledge of other worlds... and as such, has a protected status.”
What about the rest of it, Asta. “Landings by offworlders”?
“Landings by offworlders are strictly prohibited.”
That’s what the Daleks are. Strictly prohibited! Now give me that...! (GRABS PHIAL)
/BLACK DALEK: Return the phial!
(THROWS IT — EFFORT) No chance!
PHIAL SMASHES IN A FAR CORNER, OFF.
/BLACK DALEK: Resistance is futile. Kill this woman, Assessor Asta. It is your duty! Obey me! Obey!!!
My duty? (HERSELF AGAIN) My duty is to the Galactic Census! To protect this planet!
/BLACK DALEK: When my guards arrive, they shall destroy you both!
It’s hopeless, Constance.
I agree. Come on, let’s get out of here...
AS THEY RUN BACK INTO THE PASSAGEWAY:
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 117
/BLACK DALEK: Run, then! Run! There is nowhere you can hide from the power of
the Daleks!
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 118
58: EXT. MONASTERY
DOCTOR, PENDLE AND ROSCO RUN TO STOP BY WALL. ALL SLIGHTLY BREATHLESS, SLIGHTLY HUSHED.
Well, that’s handy. The shuttle retros must have blown this hole in the perimeter wall.
Madness!
Still, it’s given us another route into the monastery beside the main gate. — Right, young Rosco. You’re the expert here.
Where’s the nearest entrance to the passageways?
Oh no. Not those beastly passages again.
Gabber knew all the entrances. He was always the brave one. He said that I was too timid...
(GENTLY) If you’d rather wait here...
(DETERMINED) No, I will show you. I’ve been timid too long, Doctor. I want an end to this. I want our monastery to return to how it once was.
Good lad.
There’s a doorway near the kitchens that even Raspak doesn’t
know about. Gabber found it years ago. This way.
THEY HURRY OFF.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 119
59: INT. SECRET PASSAGEWAYS
FADE UP. CONSTANCE AND ASTA SCURRY TO STOP.
How’s your sense of direction now?
Faltering. Left, right, or straight ahead?
Let’s just keep moving, [before the Abbot’s guards catch up wit us. ]
THREE SETS OF SCURRYING FOOTSTEPS COME TO STOP IN AN
PASSAGE, JUST OFF.
Ssh! I heard footsteps.
Where-?
Just around the corner. Back the way we came. [Quick! ]
(AROUND CORNER — CLEARS THROAT) Mrs Clarke, is that you?
Doctor. (TURNS CORNER) What are you doing here?
Looking for the way to the Abbot’s chambers. I’m glad to see you're safe.
Likewise. Doctor, we took the transmitter from the shuttle.
But then the Daleks took it from us, I’m afraid.
Yes, we know. You should have destroyed it, Asta!
A Dalek mutant came after us! We nearly died!
Time enough for recriminations later.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 120
The Abbot’s chambers are this way, Doctor.
Yes, that’s where we’ve come from!
Oh, really?
It’s a long story. We hoped to use an extract of the essence of the Dream Flower to restore the Abbot’s control.
Ah. That was my plan too!
Asta? Am I to take it you know all about these ‘dream flowers’?
We read Boswyck’s scrolls.
Then I could have stayed here, rather than endure that ghastly trial on the moorland...!
Never mind that now. — Mrs Clarke, am I to take it you failed in your mission?
We couldn’t get close enough. But I’m sure the Abbot would help us, if he could only break free of the Black Dalek’s dominance.
Indeed. Rosco — change of plan. Can you show my friends the way to the Daleks’ workshop?
Yes, but —
Hopefully, the Black Dalek will soon summon his cohorts to the Abbot’s side. That should give you the opportunity to disable that transmitter.
You’re going to the Abbot’s chamber alone?
It was a good plan. It’s worth another try.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 121
But how on Earth do you think that you can... (BEAT) You’ve got your own dose of the plant extract, haven’t you? You’re going to join your mind to his!
Exactly. No time to lose. On your way, you lot.
Good luck, Doctor.
THEY ALL RECEDE DOWN THE CORRIDOR. DOCTOR TAKES A DEEP BREATH AND UNSTOPPERS THE VIAL.
Ah well. Down the hatch!
HE SWALLOWS THE LIQUID.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 122
60: INT. ABBOT’S CHAMBER
DOORS OPENED. DALEK #2 GLIDES IN.
/BLACK DALEK: Squad leader. Report!
#2: All contact with Dalek scout in the human shuttle has ceased.
/BLACK DALEK: Why?
#2: Unknown.
/BLACK DALEK:
Logical presumption: Dalek scout has been destroyed. Begin insertion of Dalek survivors into new casings. We must maintain control until reinforcements arrive!
#2: I obey.
EXITS. AS IT DOES, DOOR TO PASSAGE GRINDS OPEN SOFTLY.
/BLACK DALEK: (TO HIMSELF) The Doctor is responsible for this!
(EMERGING) I’m flattered you think so highly of me, Black Dalek.
/BLACK DALEK: Doctor...!
Very highly indeed, to judge by the images in the Abbot’s mind.
/BLACK DALEK: You have joined the collective mental pool. You have taken the extract of the Dream Flowers!
Yes, thanks to Master Boswyck.
/BLACK DALEK: Boswyck! He has betrayed his sacred vow.
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 123
And what about your sacred vow, Abbot Tanapal? I know you’re in there, listening. What about your duty to the novices in your charge — mutilated, their larynxes extracted at the Black Dalek’s behest!
/BLACK DALEK: Dalek orders are sacrosanct. Daleks are the supreme beings.
Supreme beings? Well, let me tell you - one of those “supreme beings” just recently murdered another of your novices.
/BLACK DALEK: Murdered?
His name was Gabber, “your holiness”. A young devotee of yours, traumatised by the horrors he witnessed within these walls. Do you remember him? Do you remember Novice Gabber?
/BLACK DALEK: (DALEK CONTROL FALTERING) I... remember...
And do you remember Rosco? Gabber’s twin, Rosco? Who has to live with the knowledge that he colluded with his brothers’ killers?
/BLACK DALEK: ROSCO...?
Remember Gabber. Remember Rosco. But most of all: remember yourself, Abbot Tanapal. Remember the holy man you were, before the Daleks came. And be that man again!!!
/BLACK DALEK: There is.. resistance, in my mind. Resistance!!!
That’s your resistance, Tanapal! Feel my mind in the collective consciousness! Join with me in fighting these monsters! Resist!!!
(MORE HUMAN INTONATION) Help me...
I’m here to help you. Resist!
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 124
/BLACK DALEK: (DALEKY AGAIN) Help me! — Raspak. Hear my summons! Help me!!!
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 125
61: INT. DALEKS’ CHAMBER
FADE UP. ORGANIC DALEK HEATBEAT. TRANSMITTER PULSES SOFTLY IN B/G. 2 x MONKS HAMMERING AWAY AT A DALEK CASING. 2 x OTHERS SOLDERING. ROSCO, CONSTANCE, ASTA AND PENDLE SNEAK STEALTHILY TO STOP.
NB: SOTTO VOICES THROUGHOUT.
Hush, we don’t want to disturb the brothers.
We might have to. It looks like those new casings are nearly finished.
Yes, and they’ve got plasma weapons now!
A monstrous abuse of our technology!
Go and tell them off, then!
There’s the transmitter. They’ve done work on that, too.
Well, we’d better do what we can to disable it [before—]
BARGED OPEN BEHIND AS DALEK #2 ENTERS THE ROOM.
Dalek’s coming!
Back under cover, all of you!
GLIDES UP TO SLAVES.
#2: Brothers! Prepare to place Dalek survivors into new casings.
Your Abbot demands it!
INSIDE ANIMAL STOMACHS, 2 x DALEK MUTANTS SQUEAL AND
EXCITEDLY FROM THE OTHER SIDE OF THE CHAMBER.
Oh my goodness, what was that?
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 126
The sleeping ones.
(THOUGHTFULLY) The creatures being kept alive in those animal stomachs...
It’s like they heard their new casings are nearly ready.
GLIDES OVER TO TRANSMITTER.
Now that Dalek’s gone over to the transmitter!
We'll just have to distract it.
How?
The Dalek mutants. Look at all those tubes feeding them nutrients. They must lead to a reservoir of some kind.
So, there has to be a tap or valve to shut off the flow.
I know where the pipes lead.
Good. Pendle, go with Rosco. Help him switch off the valve.
Me?
Yes, you! If you can disrupt their life support, the Dalek will have to investigate. That should give Asta and me a chance to disable the transmitter.
But—
It’s not a matter for debate, Assessor! Constance and I will be far more exposed, out in the open!
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 127
(DEEP BREATH) Oh, very well.
Follow me.
PENDLE AND ROSCO SCURRY AWAY. AS THEY DO SO THERE IS A WHINE OF POWER FROM THE TRANMITTER.
#2: Sub-space carrier established. Opening channel to main Dalek fleet.
They’d better hurry, I think that Dalek’s about to transmit!
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 128
62: INT. ABBOT’S CHAMBER
IS SLOWLY WINNING HIS FIGHT FOR MENTAL DOMINANCE.
/BLACK DALEK: (EFFORT) Raspak! To me! I need you.
Hear that, Tanapal? The Black Dalek’s rattled. He knows he’s losing his grip. You’re winning!
/BLACK DALEK: (EFFORT) Doctor. When Raspak arrives with his guards, I shall have them eviscerate you!
‘Eviscerate’? That’s a new one. But whatever you call it, it’s still murder!
(HUMAN PART) Yes, murder...!
Murder committed by men of peace!
(HUMAN) Doctor, the Dalek, I can feel its hold weakening...
Fight it, Tanapal! Exorcise the Black Dalek from your mind!
DOORS BURST OPEN. RASPAK PLUS 2 x GUARDS RUSH IN.
My Lord Abbot!
/BLACK DALEK: (EFFORT) Raspak! The Doctor is trying to poison my mind. He is trying to kill me!
Then we shall slay him! With me, brothers...!
No, Raspak, no!
ORDER OF THE DALEKS by Mike Tucker (FINAL) Page 129
63: INT. DALEKS’ CHAMBER
HEARTBEAT IS STRONGER NOW AS ROSCO AND PENDLE SCURRY TO
BESIDE THE 2 x WRIGGLING MUTANTS IN THEIR ANIMAL SACS.
NB: SOTTO VOICES UNTIL INDICATED.
Oh, the smell is just vile..!
Here is where the blood that feeds the creatures passes through into the Brandelak stomachs.
But — I see no valve, nor taps. Oh, I knew this wouldn’t work!
SIGNAL FROM TRANSMITTER ON OTHER SIDE OF CHAMBER.
